column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: MR: Movement for Renewal
column17: Two groups of MR activists, supporters of the parties president and those in opposition, clashed over control of the MRs HQ in Bukavu. Police arrived an arrested 2 members of the opposition MR activists, including ""the president of the Youth League of the opposition camp"".

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mahoro)
column17: Property destruction: Mayi Mayi Mahoro militiamen burned down the small market town of Mitamba in the Bijombo highlands during a FARDC offensive. No clashes or casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC forces clashed with Mayi Mayi Mahoro militiamen near Muhuzi in the Bijombo area, in an effort to dislodge them. No casualties were reported.

column6: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: 4 people were killed and 6 abducted by Nyatura militiamen allied with the FDLR in Kalembe village in Walikale territory.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: The traditional leader of Bambu was killed by unidentified assailants in his home, before retreating without taking anything. The incident was believed to be related to a power struggle.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: About 300 employees of the former mining company CMSK demanded payment of their wages in arrears of 9 months.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: Mayi Mayi Kifuafua militiamen have recently been accused of arbitrary imprisonment, torture, imposition of taxes and illegal fines for the past 2 months in the Kiraku area of Walikale.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR rebels have been accused of engaging in killings, lootings and extortion in the Mutanda and Kihondo groups recently (fatalities coded as 10).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
column17: Late Sunday FDLR FOCA attacked a police station, destroying it and releasing 8 inmates, as they attempted to find a young officer from their group which had been arrested. FARDC forces fought the FDLR rebels off. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 2 ADF rebels were killed in a clash with a FARDC patrol in the Kamungu area of Beni territory.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR rebels have been accused of engaging in killings, lootings and extortion in the Mutanda and Kihondo groups recently (fatalities coded as 10).

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: According to MONUSCO, 17 villagers from Luna in the Eringiti area were killed with axes and machetes by suspected ADF rebels. The fatality count of a total from two attacks on 3 May and 6 May. Gunfire was also reported by witnesses.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 3 Congolese ICRC workers were kidnapped as their convoy went through the village of Kyaghala in Rutshuru. They were later released.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: About 100 familieis fled clashes which they fighting over the past week in the Shabunda, Mwenga and Kabare areas of South Kivu between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala militias.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: About 100 familieis fled clashes which they fighting over the past week in the Shabunda, Mwenga and Kabare areas of South Kivu between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala militias.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: 1 FDLR rebel was killed during a clash with FARDC soldiers in Kaseguru, near Goma. 5 trucks were also burned during the incident. 2 civilians were also injured during the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: About 100 familieis fled clashes which they fighting over the past week in the Shabunda, Mwenga and Kabare areas of South Kivu between FARDC and Raia Mutomboki-Mabala militias.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
column17: Arrest :The deputy-leader of the FDLR-FOCA faction, Leopold Mujiambere, was arrested, and later transferred to Kinshasa by FARDC.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Strike:""Dead city"" protest strikes were held in Oicha, Mbau and Eringiti following the killing of 17 people in the village of Luna.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Strike:""Dead city"" protest strikes were held in Oicha, Mbau and Eringiti following the killing of 17 people in the village of Luna.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: FARDC and APCLS fighters clashed in the Mweso area. The only reported casualty was a lawyer and human rights activist, Roger Muteba, who was injured and later died of his wounds.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
column17: Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of the head of the National Intelligence Agency (ANR) in Kisima, Beni territory, killing him.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 06 May. On 3 and 6 May, suspected ADF elements attacked two villages in the Eringeti area and killed 36 civilians and wounded 17, including children and pregnant women. The assailants also abducted 17 civilians and looted and destroyed property.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: On 6 May 2016, 9 people were killed by about a dozen ADF rebels armed with knives and guns dressed in military uniforms who attacked the locality of Ndalya and the resort of Biane in Walesse Vonkutu chieftaincy in the Ituri area.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: The bodies of 3 FARDC soldiers were found beheaded in the Dungu area of Haut Uele. LRA rebels were the suspected perpetrators due to their activity in the area.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Arrests: About 200 people have been arrested since the beginning of May related to ""acts of insecurity"" in the Rutshuru area. Most of these have been sent to the central prison in Rutshuru.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 30 civilians were killed between May.3-10 in the Eringiti area according to MONUSCO, by ADF rebels (17 coded in a previous event).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of a police official, but encountered resistance from his guards before retreating. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: The HQ of Sokola One was moved from Beni to the Mbau-Kamango-Eringiti area where the killing of 17 people recently occurred (coded at Eringiti as the biggest town in the area, and closest to Luna, the location of the incident).

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: During a protest against a toll barrier in the Boso-Mbubu area of Bongandanga, a woman died after police fired into the air to disperse protesters. It is not clear exactly how the death occurred, but the report said the police had been ""implicated"".

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Motorcyclists from Kalemie protested against the introduction of a new ""toll road"" by the Tanganyika Revenue Directorate. The protesters destroyed three toll gates just outside Muyumba city on the road to Lubumbashi.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: A group of young people threw stones at police who were guarding the sealed HQ of UNAFEC, resulting in the police retreating from the area.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR rebels occupying in the Bwalanda area killed a man at his home. The cause of the violence was not reported.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Arrests: On May 10 it was reported that at least 30 associates of Moses Katumbi, an announced presidential contendor and former Katanga governor/PPRD member, have been arrested.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR rebels attacked military positions in Kilambo, Rutshuru, forcing FARDC soldiers to withdraw. The FDLR rebels then torched the military camp in the area and looted some houses before withdrawing. The military re-occupied the positions after the FDLR retreat.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC soldiers regained control of several localities from unidentified Mayi Mayi militias in the Lemera area of South Kivu, including Nyanzale Ruhuba, Kabumenge, Katwenge, Bubamba, Kibanga, and Kahanda. An offensive in the area had been started on May.10. No casualties were reported.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Police fired tear gas to disperse as many as several thousands supporters of Moses Katumbi outside the Lubumbashi courthouse. Police also allegedly ""chased with batons dozens of lawyers"" who had arrived to defend Katumbi and all others being investigated in connection to disturbances in Lubumbashi for free. Several people were arrested and transferred to Kinshasa. Moise Katumbi was admitted to hospital following the incident for ""exhaustion and tear gas poisoning"" and has since claimed that police ""injected him with an unknown substance"" in order to kill him.

column17: Around 500 motorcycle drivers protested on the main road of Niania, in the Isrio-Mambasa territory, over alleged demands of bribes by the Road Traffic Police (PCR). Police opened fire on the demonstrators, killing at least 4, including a student. The angry crowd then burned down houses surrounding the police station before the army arrived to disperse them. The PCR and Congolese Natonal Police commander was arrested by the military.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 5 suspected Mayi Mayi militiamen and 1 FARDC soldier were killed during an ambush by the militiamen in Tomombo village in the Mitwaba area. The sldiers were responding to reports of an attack by the militiamen.

column17: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Goma against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. Police used tear gas to disperse the protest, which was banned, while the protesters threw stones, blocked roads and burned tires. At least one protester was also allegedly killed while trying to wrestle a rifle from a police officer, while 2 police and 5 protesters were wounded, and 20 people arrested.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Demonstrations were held in Beni against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The march, which had been banned, was dispersed by police using tear gas.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Bukavu against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was dispersed by riot police ""within minutes of beginning"" and the federal secretary of the UNC was allegedly violently attacked by the police.

column7: UNADEF: National Union of Democrats and Federalists

column17: Demonstrations were held in Kalemie against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were dispersed by the police, and were attended by UNADEF and PND members.

column17: Demonstrations were held in Moba against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protest was dispersed by the police who fired warning shots. Some arrests were reported.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kinshasa against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests had earlier been banned. Police fired tear gas to disperse the protesters which numbered around 5,000, and the protesters responded by throwing stones, wounding as many as 35 police officers. An MP of the MLC, Eve Bazaiba, also claims to have been shot by the police during the march.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Election Violence: Demonstrations were held in Kananga against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. The protests were banned in Kananga, resulting in at least one event prevented before it could begin, and others violently dispersed by the police.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Electoral Violence: Demonstrations were held in Mbandaka against the judgment of the Constitutional Court authorizing President Kabila to remain in power beyond 2016 in order to organize elections. After a 2km march the police dispersed the protesters using warning shots, causing some wounds. MLC members participated in the protest.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Clashes occurred between police and students of the Higher Institute of Applied Technology (ISTA) in Kinshasa. The students were protesting to demand the release of students arrested by university police on May 24 as they distributed pamphlets advertising a march by the opposition parties. At least 30 protesters were wounded during the clash, as police allegedly used live ammo alongside tear gas to disperse the students. At least 6 policemen were also injured.

column17: FDLR rebels occupied Mweso and Bukombo following FARDC soldiers withdrawal from the areas.

column17: FDLR rebels occupied Mweso and Bukombo following FARDC soldiers withdrawal from the areas.

At least one person was seriously injured as well. The FDLR rebels also looted several houses and took livestock after the attack.

column17: The Nyatura-APCLS coalition occupied Kahira after FARDC soldiers withdrew from the locality.

column17: 2 teachers were killed in an ambush by ADF rebels in the Beni area.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: After ADF rebels killed 2 teachers, FARDC soldiers intervened and killed 2 ADF rebels before driving them off. Another civilian was killed by the ADF as they retreated.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: The Tshopo Womens Collective staged a sit-in outside the provicinial governors residence in Kisangani to protest the lack of female representation in the provincial government.

column6: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: ASP: Alliance for the Health of the People; M23: March 23 Movement
column17: Non-violent activity: The Government of the DR-Congo has approved the launch of a political party called the Alliance for the Health of the People (ASP) to replace the M23 Movement.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: FARDC soldiers have been deployed to the city of Ntoto in Walikale territory for the first time in 24 years due to ongoing security concerns in the area.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: About 50 LRA rebels raided Gamba village in the Bili chieftaincy of Bondo territory. They looted a large amount of goods, livestock and other property, and kidnapped as many as 100 people to help them carry it. Some of those kidnapped were later released.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: The headless body of a young man was found in the Nyakunde area of Ituri. ADF rebels are reportedly suspected due to the method of execution.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: LRA rebels were also reported to have attacked and looted another village in Bas Uele at the same time as their attack on Gamba in the Bili chieftaincy. No details were given on the second village attacked.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
column17: Thousands of supporters of President Kabila rallied in Kinshasa to mark the Presidents birthday. A notable in the PPRD party which supports Kabila also suggested holding a referendum to extend his rule during the event.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Prisoners at a Bunia prison held a protest over the death of one of the inmates due to illness. FARDC soldiers were deployed to prevent a breakout, and fired into the air to disperse the protest. During the incident, at least 6 inmates were injured but it was not clear how the injuries came about.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: A motorcyclist was killed in the Kalemie area by an unidentified assailant who was reported by a witness to be wearing a military uniform.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Over 200 families held a sit-in outside the territorial office of Kalehe. They were forced out of their homes in the Muhongoza area due to heavy rains.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC soldiers recovered 10 cows from Nyatura militiamen after a clash in the town of Chambombo in Kalehe territory.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Day labourers building homes in the River City area of Kinshasa went on strike and began a protest to demand two months of backpay.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Armed assailants stole money and phones from a dozen women in Basalolo in the Bunia area. The attackers also stole other property, kidnapped 4 women and wounded a man with a machete.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: During an attempted forced eviction of a military court magistrate by the security forces, a clash broke out between the security forces and soldiers attached to a neighbouring military court magistrate. At least 6 ""members of the security forces"" were arrested following the incident.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: More than 4,000 demonstrators turned out in Bili to protest against a recent mass kidnapping by the LRA in the area. They staged a sit-in in front of some residences that house FARDC officers in the area.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: A police officer shot a young man in the leg, allegedly on the orders of the territory administrator, after he had been arrested and handcuffed in Ekombe. The police officer was later arrested.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 2 soldiers were arrested after allegedly raping 2 minor girls who had been serving them at a bar in the Biakato area.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Looting: FRPI militiamen raided the village of Apinzi in Basili chiefdom in the Ituri area. They fired their guns into the areas, stole livestock, killed other animals, and attempted to kidnap the head of the village but did not succeed.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: About 50 former cabinet ministers of the outgoing government of Oriental province protested at the Place des Martyrs in Kisangani against the alleged ""hijacking"" of 150 million Congolese francs meant to clear salary arrears and allowances.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: A demonstration was on 30 June Boulevard against increases to the cost of internet across the country. 4 journalists covering the event were arrested, but later released after the intervention of the DRC National Press Union.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 2 NDC-C fighters were killed, one wounded, and 3 captured during actions as part of Operation Sokola 2 over the weekend in Walikale territory. One of those killed was allegedly the deputy leader.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR rebels have engaged in ""abuses against the indigenous peoples"" of the Buleusa area in Walikale territory recently after moving into the area. At least one person was reported killed on Jun.13.

column6: Nande Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 6 people were killed and 3 wounded in clashes between the Nande and Hutu communities due to the alleged kidnapping of a Nande by Hutu in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. 5 of those killed were Hutu IDPs while 1 Nande was also reported killed and an IDP camp burned. The violence was allegedly also related to reports that FDLR combatants were active in the IDP camp in the area.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 6 ADF rebels and 1 FARDC soldier were killed in a clash between the Kokola and Parking areas. At least 2 soldiers was also wounded and 2 ADF rebels captured. Artillery fire was heard during the clashes. The deputy commander of the ADF, Hood Lukwago, was among those killed.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
column17: During an escape from Boma prison by 26 inmates, prison guards shot one, seriously injuring him.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Cases of ""ambushes, cattle theft, illegal collection of taxes, rape, looting and killings"" have been reported to authorities in the Lubondja area between May-July 2016. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. The area is known to be a haven for FNL/Mayi Mayi groups.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 3 people were killed by gunmen (believed to be part of a network of shepherds who have been involved in attacks in the area) in Nyabibwe in the Kalehe area during the month of June.

column6: M23: March 23 Movement
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: At least 11 people were killed and others wounded as clashes broke out between demobilized combatants and FARDC soldiers in Kamina. The FARDC soldiers allegedly opened fire on thousands of demobilized M23 combatants who were protesting against the delays surrounding their reintegration by the military authorities, killing at least 10 and wounding 4. A FARDC officer was also killed with a machete by the former combatants, and 4 other soldiers wounded. The former combatants allegedly tried to invade and loot the Kamina city centre.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 14 FARDC soldiers and 37 ADF rebels have been killed in operations against the ADF since May (the deaths of 6 ADF rebels and 1 soldier coded in another event). 15 other rebels were captured, along with weapons and ammunitions and some roadside bombs. MONUSCO supported FARDC in these operations. One of the ADF rebels killed was the 2nd in command of the group (killed on June 13, coded in another event).

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
column17: Prisoners of the Dungu Central Prison rioted after the death of an inmate, leading to clashes with the prison guards. The administrator of Dungu territory says that the clashes were related to prisoners demands for improvement of conditions within the prison.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: A Mayi Mayi militia has moved into the area near Lake Edward following a withdrawal of FARDC soldiers. They are reported to have been attacking the population, including shooting a young man for refusing to pay a toll to access the lake.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 16 June. MONUSCO troops engaged Mayi-Mayi elements who had been trying to impede the distribution of food by humanitarians to internally displaced persons, resulting in the death of nine Mayi-Mayi elements.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: At least 85 people have been kidnapped from Goma since the beginning of 2016, many of whom (specifically young men) have allegedly been sold to rebels groups, specifically the ADF, who in turn sell them to other ""Muslim groups"" based on the reports of Lets Uproot Human Trafficking, an NGO based in the Eastern DRC.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 2 soldiers were killed during an ambush on the Shanje-Chambombo axis in the Kalehe area. A group of 7 gunmen from the Nyatura Mayi Mayi group were responsible.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: At least 7 NDC-R militiamen were killed and 11 others wounded in a clash with South African MONUSCO peacekeepers and FARDC soldiers in the Buleusa area of Walikale territory. They were allegedly trying to prevent food distribution to IDPs.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC soldiers regained control of Peti village from NDC-R fighters who withdrew without a fight.

column6: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: A woman was killed in the fields of the village of Biinja in the Kalembe area by FDLR-Nyatura coalition fighters.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 20 teachers from a Kisangani primary school protested to demand the provincial authorities intervene to secure 8 months backpay they are waiting on.

column6: Ntambwe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Kamalu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 1 Ntambwe man was killed and 2 others seriously injured during a clash between Kamalu and Ntambwe people related to a dispute over land in the Dibaya area.

column6: Ntambwe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Kamalu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: After a conflict broke out between the Ntambwe and Kamalu communities, residents of Ntambwe went to Kamalu village with the body of a compatriot that was killed in the clash, burned houses and injured 6 people, 3 seriously.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: More than 3,000 students from the Higher Trades Institute (SAI) protested and threw projectiles at university personnel and vehicles after the ""omission of their names on the final list of the establishment"" despite paying academic fees.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Arrests: Security forces arrested a provincial deputy and 74 others accused of belonging to a militia, ""Djeshi ya Yesu"" (Jesus Army) which had been involved in killings and mass rapes in South Kivu province. Their alleged leader Frederic Batumike is specifically accused of ordering the murder of a human rights activist, Walter Mueller, in 2012.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FARDC soldiers dismantled an FDLR position in the Kazaroho area during operations supported by MONUSCO. They also captured arms and released 6 people kidnapped on the Kibirizi-Rwindi road.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Arrests: Thierry Mukelekele, spokesman and confidante of the NDC-G leader, was arrested in Lubumbashi after delivering a ""message of peace"" whose contents was not revealed by the authorities.

column6: NDRC: National Council for Democratic Renewal
column17: Change to armed group: A new rebel group composed of former M23 and FDLR-FOCA/RUDI faction fighters, called the National Council for Democratic Renewal (NDRC), has been formed in the Rutshuru area, specifically in and around the Bwito Chiefdom. Le Potentiel reported that they are planning a major attack on Butembo.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: Looting: A Mayi Mayi group from North Kivu raided the Muchacha mining area, demanding food from the miners working there before leaving the area.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Unidentified militiamen raided Sidabo village in the Walendu Bindi area. A woman injured during the raid later died of her injuries.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
column17: Manu and Sumbadede Mayi Mayi militiamen fought between June.27-28 over a mining site in the Muchacha area of the Okapi Wildlife Reserve.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 10 FRPI militiamen were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers in the village of Kienge in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom. 2 soldiers were seriously wounded in the clash which began as the soldiers attempted to dismantle militia positions.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Unidentified gunmen raided Kailenge village in the Walikale area. During the attack they clashed with FARDC soldiers who forced them to retreat. One soldier was wounded in the battle.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Manu)
column17: Manu and Sumbadede Mayi Mayi militiamen fought between June.27-28 over a mining site in the Muchacha area of the Okapi Wildlife Reserve.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 13 Nyatura militiamen attacked a FARDC position in Kavumu in South Kivu. Both groups clashed with heavy weapons.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: An attack by the FRPI on military positions in the village of Kiboba in the Walendu Bidni area resulted in a soldier and a militiamen killed.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: At least 3 clashes occurred between FDLR and FARDC forces in the Bwito chieftaincy in the Rutshuru area. These included 2 killed and 4 injured in Katsiro locality and 2 killed in the Bishusha area.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: At least 3 clashes occurred between FDLR and FARDC forces in the Bwito chieftaincy in the Rutshuru area. These included 2 killed and 4 injured in Katsiro locality and 2 killed in the Bishusha area.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 30 June. FARDC, with MONUSCO support, clashed with suspected Allied Democratic Forces elements east of Oicha. Two FARDC soldiers were killed and another two were wounded, and one MONUSCO peacekeeper was slightly injured. Three presumed elements of that group were killed and two were captured by FARDC.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: The body of a uniformed FARDC soldier was found in the NDjili river in Kinshasa on Jun.30.

column6: NDC-C: Nduma Defense of Congo (Cheka)
column17: The NDC-R and NDC-C militias clashed in the Mironge and Taka villages of Mutongo locality. 2 NDC-R fighters were reported killed during the clash.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Nyatura-APCLS Coalition: Nyatura-Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: Fighters of the APCLS-Nyatura coalition attacked several FARDC positions simultaneously in the morning in the Lwibo and Lukweti areas of Masisi territory. Different reports said either 6 soldiers or a single major were killed, while between 6-8 assailants were killed and one captured along with weapons (coded as 7 fatalities total). Later in the day the Kinyumba area also saw an attack but the assailants were fought off without reported casualties.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Following a death of a prisoner in the custody of the Congolese national police, residents of Kafe burned the offices and buildings belonging to members of the security forces. They also took three women police officers and their dependents hostage, saying they will be released once the cause of the prisoners death was clarified.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 2 miners were injured in clashes with guards of a COMIDE mining site in Lenga, in Lualaba province, during a riot after they were denied access despite promises by the provincial government.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column16: Xinhua; AFP; Radio Okapi; Local Source
column17: 9 civilians were killed by suspected ADF rebels in the Tenambo, Nzanza and Mamiki localities of Oicha. A secondary source claims the attack may have instead occurred on 05/07.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Traders in Kinshasa protested in and around the cities central market over the murder of a Congolese national in India. Many shops remained closed and police were deployed to prevent retaliation against the Indian population of the city. There were some reports of attacks against Indian shops.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC soldiers secured the release of spouses and children of police officers who had been kidnapped by Mayi Mayi militia after the soldiers pursued and tracked down the kidnappers.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: Mayi Mayi militiamen kidnapped four police officers spouses and 3 children after a weapons cache of theirs was captured by FARDC soldiers.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftaincy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftaincy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Reports of attacks against Indian shops have continued following the murder of a Congolese national in India. Police forces have had to intervene and place Indian shops under their protection.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftaincy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: Suspected LRA poachers kidnapped 8 people in an attack on Ongonga village in Bafakoi area of Wamba territory. They also raped people, looted the village, and wounded 2 people with gunfire. The kidnapped people were made to carry the property stolen by the assailants.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: NDC-R and FDLR-Nyatura coalition forces clashed in several localities of Bwito chieftaincy, including Kikuku, Katobo, Kitanda and Kitunda. The NDC-R allegedly took control of part of the Kikuku area during the clashes. No casualties were reported.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: A youth group from Mahagi protested to oppose the arrests of 4 journalists and some human rights activists in the village of Zengu.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 5 soldiers traveling near Kalera fell into an ambush set by Mayi Mayi militiamen, forcing them to retreat.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: After following some soldiers they had ambushed to Kalera, some Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked the city, killing 4 people and beheading a policeman.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Armed groups carried out attacks on 8 villages in the Onimba locality between Walikale and Lubero in the Usala group between Jul.3-13, resulting in 5,000 inhabitants fleeing their homes due to insecurity. Homes, schools, churches and health centres were burned during the attacks. The areas affected are localities of Mubi, Kilambo, Njingala and Boboro.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: Fighting has been reported between unidentified Mayi Mayi militias in the Nyanzale area, leading to displacement.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: Fighting has been reported between FARDC and FDLR forces in the Nyanzale area, leading to displacement.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column9: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: 4 people, including a MONUSCO peacekeeper, were injured in a clash between the NDC-R and the FDLR-Nyatura-APCLS coalition in Kikuku that was then broken up by MONUSCO forces who intervened to protect the population of the area.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 13 people were wounded during a fight between two groups of students from the University of Kisangani over use of communal spaces. Police attempted to disperse two groups of clashing Kisangani students with tear gas and aerial firing but were unable to deter them.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: The residence of about 100 Faculty of Agricultural Sciences Institute of Yangambi students was burned down after the resumption of clashes between students of that institution and the University of Kisangani. It was not clear if a clash accompanied the arson, and no casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 2 suspected ADF gunmen wearing old Ugandan military uniforms were killed in a clash with FARDC soldiers near the border village of Kotongo.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 17 people were abducted by 10 FRPI militiamen during raids on the localities of Mandibe 1 and 2 near Komanda in Ituri territory. A man was shot and two women raped during the assault.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: After FRPI kidnapped 17 people in a raid in the Mandibe localities, FARDC soldiers intervened and freed some of the hostages during a clash with the FRPI.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: CF: Citizen Front
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Several members of Citizen Front, the G7, and other groups were arrested during a sit-in outside the office of the provincial assembly of Tshopo in Kisangani. They were demanding the release of a member of Citizen Front who had been arrested on Friday.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: Fighting was reported between NDC-R and Nyatura forces in the Buluma area of Rutshuru.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
column7: Militia (Mangalibi Sadala)
column17: A coalition of three Mayi Mayi militias (Simba, Mangalibi and Simon) have occupied the mining area of Muchacha in the Okapi Wildlife Reserve in Ituri territory.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 13 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: FDLR forces attacked a FARDC position in the Tongo-Rusheshe area of Rutshuru territory, resulting in 1 soldier and 1 FDLR rebel dead and 2 others injured. The FARDC soldiers were forced into a temporary withdrawal which allowed the FDLR rebels to burn their camp before the soldiers were able to return with reinforcements the next morning.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 14 August. On 13 and 14 July, in response to cooperation between Congolese security forces and MONUSCO that aimed at preventing illegal activities in Virunga National Park, Mayi-Mayi Charles elements fired at MONUSCO helicopters and burned down a FARDC post near the park.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: FARDC soldiers clashed with the PARECO Mayi Mayi militia over 4 days in the Bingi and the surrounding area of the Lubero territory, resulting in many displaced. On the 14th at least 3 militiamen were killed in a battle near the village of Mutiri and 4 wounded, while at least 1 soldier was killed during the clashes according to civil society and another seriously injured.

column9: JUNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Youth
column17: A group of JUNAFEC members armed with knives attacked fellow members of their party associated with a different faction, resulting in serious injuries. Some of those involved were later arrested.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
column17: 2 youths were killed in the Rutshuru area during fighting between Mayi Mayi Mazembe militiamen and another unidentified Mayi Mayi militia.

column6: Bakabeya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Members of the Bakabeya clan allegedly attacked members of a rival clan in the Kisiki locality, stealing their property, burning their houses, and assaulting them during the incident. About 150 people were displaced as a result of the incident.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 50 people, including the South African contingent of MONUSCO and members of the Volunteer Association of the Congo (ASVOCO), took part in a peace march in Goma ahead of Nelson Mandela Day.
