Hundreds of people attended, included the community from the Bel Air de Ruwenzori quartier, the most affected by massacres and insecurity. The protesters were dispersed by police who resorted to tear gas at roundabout Nyamwisi. Police arrested 42 LUCHA supporters and released them the same evening.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 April 2018. An unidentified armed group, who spoke Azande and Acholi, looted two men on the way to their fields in the Niangara area of Haut Uele.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 26, unidentified armed men killed a 40-year old man in Kibenete village, Rutshuru, when he was returning from the Kikuku market.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
column17: On April 26, the FDLR-FOCA attacked the FARDC in Katale, seeking revenge for the destruction of their their charcoal kiln.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On April 26, the FRPI ambushed a vehicle carrying policemen in Boga. It is unclear if there was an exchange of fire. The assailants stole the policemen's property and fled to Kabona.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 April, women in Beni town held a sit-in in front of the Mayor's office to denounce the ongoing insecurity and massacres in the country. A protest march was organised the following day.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around 27 April, a LUCHA militant was reportedly kidnapped by authorities in Lubumbashi and held not far from the town. The incident came as the group has been increasingly denouncing the daily crimes occurring in the city and the failure of the authorities to intervene.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 27 April, thousands of Congolese women marched in Beni town against the ongoing insecurity and massacres in the country. Police escorted the women during the march.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 27, a group of FARDC was surprised by assailants in Langbe (grouping Buku), but the attack was repelled.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On the night of April 27-28, presumed FRPI rebels attacked the positions of the FARDC in Karasi, periphery of Geti. The attack targetted simultaneously civilian houses and the FARDC, but was repelled by the armed forces.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 28 April. A MONUSCO patrol was attacked and stoned by at least 700 civilians in the Rwangoma district of Beni city. Several Peacekeepers got injured

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On April 28 and 29, the Nyatura launched offensives in Rutshuru. On 29 April, the Nyatura attacked the state forces in Bondase (grouping Tongo). One Nyatura was killed, one AK-47 recovered and 2 civilians injured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On April 28 and 29, the Nyatura launched offensives in Rutshuru. On 29 April, the Nyatura attacked Kirumba (grouping Tongo). 2 soldiers were killed, one of which was a lieutenant, and 2 AK 47s were taken.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 28 and 29, the Nyatura launched offensives in Rutshuru. On April 28, the attack was on Nyanzale (grouping Kihondo), where two people were killed during a clash with an unknown armed group.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 29, a group of armed men attacked Mugunga, 10km west of Goma. 8 people were killed and 22 others injured. The attackers raided the kiosks and boutiques.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 29, unidentified armed men entered Goma and launched an indiscriminate attack on civilians. The attack took place near a shopping mall called Kasoko Amour, where the rebels killed 3 and then proceeded to shoot indiscriminately. According to the mayor, the deathcount was at least 7 civilians (4 died later due to wounds) and 18 other injured persons.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: Nsapu Clan Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Nsapu Clan Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On the night of of April 30 - May 1, rival clans (""Dissident Apostles"" vs ""Young Builders"") of the leading family in Nsapu village, Dibaya, clashed unexpectedly, leaving at least 3 killed (local sources point to 5 deaths), including the newly appointed leader of the Kamwina Nsapu militia, Kanku Nkata. One of the clans was opposing the other clan's rapprochement with the government. It is unclear to what extent the Kamwina Nsapu militia was involved in the feud.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 30, civilians barricaded the street linking Goma to Sake in protest against the police inaction in the indiscriminate attack by gunmen in Goma the day before. Others entered the hospital where the injured persons had been taken to.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 30, unidentified armed men killed a civilian in Musimba village, Lubero.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On April 30, unidentified armen men killed a man in Mitamba village, Uvira. On the same day, a vehicle was held up by unidentified armed men close to Gongwa village, in Uvira, and the assailants killed a local leader, abducted two people and looted some goods.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 1 May 2018 (as reported), a man was found decapitated by a machete in Musavayiro village in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The perpetrators are unknown.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 1 May, 3 FDLR-RUD rebels entered into a house in Kashwa 3 village, Rutshure, and abducted a 60 year old woman.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On May 1, the FDLR-RUD targeted a convoy close to Busendo village, in Rutshuru. 4 rebels and 2 FARDC soldiers were killed; 2 civilians and one soldier were injured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 1, a FARDC soldier killed a 72 year old man in Kavalala, Beni. When civilians were trying to recover the body, the FARDC shot trying to disperse them and injured another 6.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 1, LUCHA militants protested in Goma to show support for the victims of the recent massacres in Beni, but also against the extensive kidnappings in North Kivu. Several protesters were arrested (a dozen according to one report, at least 31 according to another). The protesters were released on the same day.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 1 May 2018, presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen threatened the chief of Irango locality in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu), who alerted a PNC commander. The PNC attempted to attack the Mayi Mayi without success. Mayi Mayi hit him with a machete and he passed away at the hospital.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Weapons Seizure: On May 2, a vehicle carrying ammunition in boxes and bulk was seized in Goma by the military. The vehicle was reportedly carrying them for armed groups active in the North-East of the province.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
column17: On May 3, Mayi-Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two people from Kibanga, Uvira.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 3 May 2018, a farmer was attacked, injured and later kidnapped by presumed ADF rebels from his farm just outside Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: Kibanga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 3 May 2018, after Mwenyemali rebels abducted people from Kibanga, people from the village armed themselves and initiated a pursuit, during which they fired at the rebels, although in vain.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03 May. During the night, suspected police officers (most in civilian clothing, one wearing part of a police uniform) apprehended four suspected Kuluna members from their homes in Kalamu and killed them. They forced one victim to strip and ordered him to 'have sex with a tree' and shot him in the back as he was undressing. The victims were unarmed at the time. The attacks are believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 3, police deployed at the residence of Gabriel Kyungu wa Kumwanza dispersed a group of LUCHA protesters to prevent a protest from taking place and blocked the roads leading to the residence of the former president of the provincial assembly.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 4, artisanal miners protested in Rubaya against the closing of the Coltan mines by the Mining Society of Bisunzu (SMB). The Masisi-Goma road was barricaded, several boutiques were pillaged. Several of the people were armed with assault weapons.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 4, Twiganeho combatants clashed with unidentified armed men attacking cattle Kinyunyi village, Uvira. During the clash, 5 civilians were killed.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Property destruction: Around 4 May, reports of are armed men with machettes and bows and arrows preventing people from accessing their fields in the chiefdom of Bahema-Nord in Djugu and destroying fields in Mbukana, Batsi, Bofi, Lombu, bulu, Ngau and Lupa.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Weapons Seizure: On the night of Saturday to Sunday May 6, 5 people were arrested in Bunia with armed weapons. The operation started on Friday 4 in the quarters of Salongo, Sukisa and Kindia. On the night before, the police found 5 AK 47s in the house of people who belonged to the FARDC. In another house on the same night, an AK 47 was found with 500 ammunitions.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: MDK: Movement for the Development of Kasai
column17: Around 5 May, 5 people from the ONG 'Movement for the Development of the Kasai' have died in Kananga trying to defuse explosives.

column6: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Report of clashes between the Banyamulenge and Bafulero groups in Uvira starting on April 30. 8 people were killed over 30 April-5 May. On 6 May, the two groups clashed again in Banyamulenge, also Uvira, leaving another two killed.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On the night of May 5-6, presumed FRPI rebels attacked two villages in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, around 60km south of Bunia. The second attack was in Mahere, where they injured a man after beating him up.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 6, unidentified armed men attacked Mugogo village, in Uvira, killing a woman and a policeman.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On the night of May 5-6, presumed FRPI rebels attacked two villages in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, around 60km south of Bunia. The first attack was in Koni, where the rebels attacked the village and, after the population signalled the attack, FARDC forces arrived and clashed with them. 2 rebels were killed and 3 others injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 7 May 2018 (as reported), the body of a farmer was found dead in his field in Kudukudu village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) 16km away from Mangina.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 7, unidentified armed men kidnapped a woman and a girl in Kibende, Rutshuru.They demanded a $1.500 ransom to release the hostages. On the same day, in Kise, Rutshuru, unidentified gunmen abducted two people. One of the hostages managed to escape but the other one did not. The ransom increased from $500 per person to $1.500.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 7 May 2018 (as reported), the body of a woman with machete cuts was found in her cabin on her field in Kaukabo village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 7, armed people attacked and killed man in Nzenga I village, Beni.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 7, artisanal diggers demonstrated in Rubaya against the suspension of the exploitation of coltan by the Mining Society of Bisunzu (SMB). Several of them were arrested by the police. The protesters tried to barricade the route Goma-Masisi, and several of them were injured during the altercations with police. According to different sources, one or two AK 47 weapons were held in the middle of the crowd.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 May 2018, armed men entered Ntoma village in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and killed an older woman with a machete before vanishing.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mesandu)
column17: On May 8, the troops of colonel Thomas Mesandu took over the control of the village of Mayunga, in Ubundu. The transfer of control was done without any combat, fighting or violence. Most of the civilians fled to the villages of Kitambala, Masiri and Walengola Lowa, or the forest. Militaries fled to Lowa. The rebels burned the office of the FARDC

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 8, unidentified armed men killed a woman in Ndosho. The victim's body was found the morning after and her son went missing.

column6: CNPSC: National Coalition of the People for Congo's Sovereignty
column17: On May 8, 25 armed CNPSC rebels raided Namaona village, in Fizi. They looted goods and forced civilians to go with them to carry the goods. It is unclear if the civilians were released afterwards.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 8, unidentified armed men attacked Pakanza, Oicha, and shot a couple. The woman died.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column9: Kasitu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 May 2018, a local chief was kidnapped by presumed Mayi Mayi from his village in Kasitu (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 9 May 2018, peasants were kidnapped from their fields by ADF rebels just outside Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They took 8 people to Zavyahi and 3 people to Mambabila and an unknown destination.

column6: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On the week of 7 May, the Kulunas attacked the comune of Nzanza, in Matadi.

column6: Kalehe Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, unidentified armed men stole fishermen's nets near Lake Kivu, in Minova, and killed one of them.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, armed men broke into a house in Butemure, Masisi, and killed Butemure's local chief.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, armed men kidnapped five women and five men from Mbongya, Mabambila and Nyaleke villages in Beni. On the same day, unidentified armed men killed a man in Malolu village, Beni.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, armed men shot and killed a policeman in Kisuma, and wounded another.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, unidentified armed men broke into a hotel in Kambara village in Walungu killing a policeman guarding the building and looting goods and money.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, armed men kidnapped five women and five men from Mbongya, Mabambila and Nyaleke villages in Beni. On the same day, unidentified armed men killed a man in Malolu village, Beni.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 9, armed men kidnapped five women and five men from Mbongya, Mabambila and Nyaleke villages in Beni. On the same day, unidentified armed men killed a man in Malolu village, Beni.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Security Measures: the commander of the operational sector Sokola 1 in Grand North announced on May 9 the beginning of a curfew during three days, targetting the the military, police officers and authors of insecurity in the city.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 10 May 2018, a FARDC colonel inflicted violence on civilians of Kamango village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), giving each worker 40 lashes after forcing them to work illegally for him on his cacao farm.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 10 May, near Lindimbia, approximately at 17:00, 3 civilians were reportedly abducted by a suspected LRA group as they were collecting water at a water source 22 km northwest of Bangadi, DRC.

column6: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
column17: On May 10, the Kamwina Nsapu killed 8 people in the locality of Mulombela, in Dibaya. They attacked around 13h, killing a couple and their 6 kids. Another report mentions that at least there were 4 deaths, but with a mention that a military source stated 8. On May 12, 8 deaths were confirmed. The head of the assassinated family is the brother of the current village chief. The militia was headed by David Ndaye Kalonga, a.k.a. Nsabanga.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 10, unidentified gunmen attacked the FNL/Nbizi in Kahololo village, Uvira. 2 FNL soldiers were killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 10, armed men kidnapped a priest from Rugarama, Masisi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 10, unidenified gunmen broke into the house of the local chief in Nyakibamba, Idjwi, and killed him. A man and a boy were also killed during their runaway.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 10, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man from Sovere, Walikale, and asked for a ransom.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 10, the FARDC shot two policemen, obeying the orders of their intelligence officer commander, in Nyange, Fizi. The policemen were refusing to release from custody the cousin of the commander. Four policemen were injured, but the prisoner was not released.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 10, students protested in Kinshasa in three different campuses against the rising price of transportation. The police arrested 14 of them after trying to disperse them with tear gas.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 11 May 2018, 35 people who attended a funeral were ambushed and fired on by presumed ADF rebels in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). One of them died in the attack.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column9: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
column16: Xinhua; RFI; Daily Monitor (Uganda); AFP; AP
column17: On May 11, a MONUSCO convoy was attacked by presumed Mayi Mayi Hapa na pale in Tanganyka province. Two UN members went missing, while the remaining 11 were safe. Another report by Xinhua mentions that 13 UN soldiers were abducted, but that 11 were released. The 2 missing UN soldiers were found on May 16. The Hapa na pale are supported by, or in a coalition with, the Yakutumba and Malaika, and the three groups are part of the CNPSC.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
column16: Xinhua; Radio Okapi; Deutsche Welle; AFP; RFI; Reuters
column17: On May 11, an ICCN ranger was killed by unidentified armen men at Virunga National Park (precisely, between Kilimanyoka and Kibumba), and 3 people were kidnapped, of which 2 British tourists. All three hostages were release on May 13.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 11 May 2018, at least 34 people carried the dead man's body in protest to the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), after his death in an ambush by ADF rebels. [size=at least 34]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Uganda)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around 11 May 2018 (between 11 - 12 May), armed bandits from Uganda crossed the border to attack Kasindi village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). FARDC and PNC patrollers intercepted them on their way and killed one of them, and arrested two. 3 others fled to an unknown location.

column6: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 May, a merchant was kidnapped by unidentified armed men in the Mongwalu-Lopa axis and has since then been missing. Authorities accused incident to be part of renewed clashes between the Hema and Lendu.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 12 May. Rioters stoned a MONUSCO patrol in Boikene.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 May, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], unidentified men armed with knives killed 1 boy and 1 young man from the same family. Neighbors reported that the assailants, dressed in robes, killed the boys when they refused to give the cassava, groundnuts, rice, and corn they were transporting.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 12 May. Suspected police forces, apprehended four males in Kalamu. The body of one of the detainees was found, while the other three remain missing. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 12, 'youth for peace' protested in Bunia. The protest was dispersed by police who resorted to tear gas, and the mayor claimed that the protest was not authorised. Some of the protesters were arrested.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 13, ANR agents arrested a man in Bulambo, Beni, for suspicion of him belonging to the Mayi Mayi Mazembe. The detainee was taken to the FARDC camp, where he was tortured and died. The FARDC buried the body without informing the family.

column6: Rutshuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 13, unidentified armed men raided Rutsiro village, in Rutshuru, during the night. A 35-year old man was kidnapped and a ransom was demanded for his release.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: After the clashes between rioters who clashed because of the game, the police intervened and had to use tear gas to disperse the crowd.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: ""One INGO staff member was abducted near Penemede, near the administrative border between South Kivu and Maniema, when armed men ambushed an INGO motorcycle convey composed of five workers. Two motorcycles were also taken in the attack. The whereabouts of the worker and the motive for the attack are unknown at this time.""

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 May 2018, a farmer was ambushed in his field by an unknown armed group in Ndomu village in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu). He was rushed to a hospital to attend to his wounds.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: On May 14, the FARDC attacked the CNRD position in Busumba. The attack resulted in one soldier and one rebel dead.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Kabare Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 14, unidentified men close to Mugererebo, in Kabare, stole sixteen fishermen's nets. The FARDC intervened and captured one of the assailants.

column6: Rutshuru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 14, unidentified armen men tried to hold up a vehicle in Vitshumbi. The driver accelerated, and the rebels shot, killig the man.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 14, student protesters protesting against the rising costs of public transports clashed with police in Kinshasa. 8 students were injured, 2 of them seriously. 2 medical employees were also hurt. MONUSCO is accused of playing a role through inciting students to protest. This protest comes the week after another protest led to the arrest of 14 students who were protesting the same cause.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Agreement: Around 60 children left the FRPI group in Ituri between April-June 2018.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 15, unidentified armed men attacked Mirangi, in Rutshuru, to steal cows. The Nyatura Domi were alerted by the population and intervened to prevent the looting. During the clash, 4 shepherds were killed and 5 injured. 30 cows were stolen.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 15, unidentified gunmen in Mayangose village, Beni, kidnapped a couple.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On May 15, the FARDC launched a search and rescue operation and captured 18 RED-TABARA rebels in Matarule. Some military items were also seized.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Lubumbashi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 15, the Congolese police clashed with inhabitants of Lubumbashi commune who protested against the return of insecurity to the city. The protest, which turned into a clash, pertained to an attempted robbery the night before. 12 people were injured during the protest, while stalls were burned.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
column17: On May 16, a clash between presumed Mayi Mayi Mazembe and Nyatura led to the killing of 5 civilians, with 5 others injured, in Mirangi, Rutshuru.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 16 May 2018, youths of Talyata district took to the streets in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to demonstrate against the killing of a farmer by a soldier after he refused to give the soldier his goats. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 16, unidentified gunmen abducted the chief of Kasitu locality, Kunguta village, in Beni.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 16, a FARDC soldier killed a man and his son in the Paida neighbourhood of Beni, while he was trying to steal their goat.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 16, the police dispersed a peaceful demonstration in Kamituga. The students demanded the rehabilitation of the national road. 3 students and 2 more protesters were arrested; 2 students were injured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 16, the FARDC attacked an unidentified armed group in Mianzi village, Shabunda. 2 rebels were killed and 2 AK47s retrieved.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 16, the general of the CAR militia Anti-Balaka was arrested in Kanzau, Bondo, along with around 30 of his men. The general had sought refuge there after a clash with the FARDC.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 16, students belonging to the National Pedagogical University protested in Kinshasa over the payment of extra 50 USD demanded by the university authorities, aside from 150 USD for their diplomas. The police dispersed the protesters using tear gas.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 17 May 2018, a farmer and his wife failed to return from their fields just outside Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an assumed abduction by ADF rebels.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 May 2018, unknown gunmen abducted a husband and raped his wife who were in their fields in Polopondo, 2km away from Kyatsaba in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The woman was left in the field.

column6: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 17, more than 20 Kuluna rebels attacked the commune of Mvuzi, in Matadi. They destroyed property and looted goods from civilians, having injured also many people.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 17, unidentified gunmen raided Bigizi, in Kalehe, and raped a woman. They took her to the forest with her 5-year old child and also looted goods.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 17, a crowd was carrying a man's body to the mortuary in Beni when the police intervened to disperse it. The crowd was also protesting against the FARDC.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On 17 May 2018, presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen took goats from civilians in Bungulu district in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 18, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in the Mabanga-Nord neighbourhood of Goma, abducted 2 girls and looted goods.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 18, unidentified gunmen killed a civilian close to Mugeri.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 18, two unidentified groups clashed in Kamatare, Masisi, and one person died.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 18, unidentified armed men killed the local chief - Mandra Mazibo - of the Kanvinvira area in Uvira.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On May 18, the NDC Guidon and Cheka clashed in Robe, Walikale. 2 NDC Guidon were killed and 2 were injured; on the Cheka side, 1 was killed, 1 was injured and 1 was captured.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 19 May, in Badolo, an LRA group abducted 12 civilians, including 3 young boys, 2 young girls, and 7 adult men. They spoke Lingala and Acholi, and wore UPDF-like uniforms.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column8: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column17: 19 May. Fighting between MONUSCO/DRC forces and ADF continues in the area surrounding Beni. Causality figures not known.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Non-violent activity: On 19 May, the Congolese police forces interrupted the burrial of activist Rossy Mukendi by using tear gas to disperse the crowd.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Non-violent activity: On May 19, the police prevented a meeting from the ""Ensemble pour le changement"" electoral coalition led by opposition candidate Moise Katumbi in Bunia. The police deployed to several locations in Bunia, in order to prevent even journalists from accessing the hotel where the meeting was due to take place.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On May 19, 6 Ugandan fishermen were kidnapped by Mayi Mayi rebels close to Lake Edward, in the region of Kagezi. They are being held hostage in Kyondo.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On May 19, people took to the streets and barricaded the routes between DRC and Burundi to protest the killing of the local chief the night before. Several tires were burned; there were many youth protesting. Some barricades were set in front of MONUSCO, but after the latter engaged in conversation, they were removed.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 May, various women's groups and women parliamentarians marched in Lubumbashi, the provincial capital of Katanga, to protest violence against women.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 20, the Raia Mutomboki Hamakombo attacked the FARDC in Kambale, but the attack was repelled.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 20, a FARDC soldier shot two civilians in Kisunga, Beni. A man died and another woman was shot to the stomach. On the same day, a soldier shot another man in Lyakobo neighbourhood; the victim died on the spot.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 20 May. ADF attacked FARDC in Mayimoya and killed 10 civilians

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On May 20, military forces clashed with presumed ADF rebels who had just attacked Mbau northeast of Beni and killed 10 civilians (coded in a separate VAC event). The clash lasted 3h and the FARDC managed in the end to repel the assailants. The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On May 20, presumed ADF rebels attacked Mbau northeast of Beni. 9 civilians were killed during the attack and 2 injured. Radio Okapi and AFP mention that casualties were 10, later confirmed by the army and civil society. The attack started at 18h30, with rebels burning a vehicle, pillaging stores and businesses, and killing civilians who inhabited the location. The military eventually intervened and the clash lasted for 3h, with the FARDC managing in the end to repel them (coded in a separate battle event). The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Non-violent activity: On May 20, the national coordinator of the 'Ensemble' platform, Jean Claude Kibala, survived a kidnapping attempt. The kidnappers approached his chauffer and put a gun to this head. When Jean left the car, they tried to make him get inside a car without a plate. He refused and some civilians passed by at that point. The kidnappers were disuaded and the kidnapping was avoided.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 21, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in Misisi, Fizi, and killed the head of the household before looting goods and money.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 21, a 41 year old man was killed in Lwango village, Kalehe, with a crude weapon.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 21, unidentified gunmen broke into the Kibondwe neighbourhood in Uvira territory and killed a head of household.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 21, unidentified gunmen attacked the FARDC in Ishenge, Uvira territory. They injured 3 soldiers and stole their belongings.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 21, the Mazembe ambushed a motor cycle transporting 2 FARDC soldies in Butindiri, Rutshuru. The soldiers and the driver were killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 21, a man was killed by unidentified gunmen in the Keyshero neighbourhood of Goma.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 21, a police member of the traffic control brutalised a taxi-moto driver in Kisangani. The driver is alive but hospitalised.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 21, a convoy composed of 2 vehicles and 21 motorbikes was attacked in the Virunga National Park. 2 soldiers and 1 civilian were killed. The attack comes 10 days after another attack took place in Virunga National Park. The Mayi Mayi are accused of being the perpetrators.

column6: Kete Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Mpiang Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On the night of May 20-21, an armed group attacked the village of Matopolo, in the grouping Kalamba Dilondo, in Mweka, and killed 8 people all belonging to the Mpiang group. 13 others were injured during the attack (MSF mentions 12 dead according to official sources). The attackers are presumably from the Kete community.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Idjwi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 22, the Congolese naval force clashed with an armed group in Lake Kivu, Idjwi. The attackers envisaged to steal from fishermen when these called the naval force. Upon their arrival, the clash took place. A sergeant and two fishermen were hurt by bullets and later died from their injuries.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: May 22, report that NDC-R elements have occupied Karambi 11km south of Bingi. Three days later, they ambushed a vehicle and kidnapped passengers.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 22, a 32 year old man was abducted in Kyanguwe village, Lubero. He had witnessed the killing of Mwami Kambere Mbalulinda on October 8-9. The victim was found dead in Talihya river days later.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On May 22, the APCLS whipped a man in Bunyere village, Rutshuru. The man died from the wounds.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 22 May, in Madi, 3 Ugandan and 3 Congolese LRA combatants abducted 6 men and 1 young woman and looted 61 civilians. The assailants wore uniforms similar to the FARDC's and spoke Acholi and Lingala.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 22 May - 25 May. FARDC launched 'operation hero' against FRPI in Ituri area. 7 FRPI elements killed. Exact date of combat not known.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 22-23 May: youth of Kisangani protested for two days against the police for having brutalised a taxi-moto driver the day before, pelting stones. Police dispersed the protest with tear gas.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 22, a group of 5 FARDC soldiers attacked a vehicle belonging to Agro Action Allemande (AAA). The attack was meant to steal money. One civilian was injured. The 5 soldiers and the organiser of the attack were arrested and condemned the week after.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: ""Armed assailants ambushed an INGO vehicle that was transporting cash from an airfield to the city center in Irumu territory. When the vehicle came under fire, the four aid workers onboard abandoned the vehicle and ran to hide in the bush. Although two aid workers were able to escape, the other two were found by the gunmen. They were assaulted and stabbed.""

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 23, unidentified gunmen attacked in Makako, Djugu, killing 4 people with machetes (2 men, a woman and a baby). Four others are reported missing.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 23, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a vehicle carrying FARDC soldiers and civilians close to Butindiri, Rutshuru. 2 soldiers and 4 civilians were shot and wounded.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 22-23 May: youth of Kisangani protested for two days against the police for having brutalised a taxi-moto driver the day before, pelting stones. Police dispersed the protest with tear gas.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 24 May, in Mangbungulu, a group of 3 armed LRA forces, including one woman, ambushed two cyclists traveling to Banda. The LRA forces looted the victims and held them captive for three hours before releasing them.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On the night of 23-24 May, a FARDC soldier was ambushed by the FNL between Kiliba and the grouping of Runingu. The soldier was killed while on patrol. The FARDC arrived after and the clash allegedly led to 3 rebel deaths.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale); Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 24 May 2018, in Namoya, a coalition of Mai-Mai Malaika of Sheikh Assani, Mai-Mai Yakutumba and Mai-Mai Apa na Pale attacked an FARDC position. The aim of the attack was reportedly to loot military materiel. At least 30 dead (18 soldiers, 8 rebels).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 24, the FARDC clashed with the ADF in the Mbau-Kamango axis. This group is the same that had attacked Beni on May 20. According to UN sources 12 FARDC soldiers and 16 ADF rebels killed.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 24, clashes took place between students and taxi moto drivers in Malemba. The clashes started because a student who was on a taxi moto started an argument with the driver. The argument quickly turned violent, with students and other drivers joining the conflict, both sides pelting stones, and leading to injuries on both sides. During the clash, 4 houses were ransacked. Police intervened to disperse the parties.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 24, the vice-president of the Confederation of Currency Dealers (COCAM) was killed in Kinshasa by a group of armed men.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On May 25, an ambush by NDC-Rassailants in the Bingi-Bunyatenge axis led to 20 motards and their passengers to be kidnapped.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On 25 May 2018, presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen abducted a man in Maboya village in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu), after allegedly confusing him for the head of the intelligence service. A ransom was posted for his release.

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On May 26, more than 20 people were kidnapped from several locations in Rutshuru, including Kasenyi and Kibututu. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rude.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 26 May. MONUSCO deployed troops to Saramabila area two days after the attack on the Banro mining site

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On May 26, more than 20 people were kidnapped from several locations in Rutshuru, including Kasenyi and Kibututu. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rude.

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On May 26, 9 people were abducted not far from Kiwanja. One of them was killed when he resisted the kidnapping. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 26, unidentified gunmen abducted three people from Katobo. They were found dead days later in a ravine.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On May 26, the FARDC clashed with the FRPI in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, and two rebels were killed. 2 AK47 weapons were also retrieved.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 26, a clash broke out between miners and security forces in Banalia. The artisanal miners were informed that they had to pay an institutional tax in order to exploit the resources and were obliged by the forces to do so, which they refused. What ensued was a coleric mob trying to break through the police barrier that prevented the access to the mines. One miner was injured.

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On May 26, 3 people - one motard and two clients - were kidnapped in the chiefdom of Bwito, in Mutanda. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
column7: Hutu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 26, 4 people were kidnapped in Kitobo, 6km south of Kitshanga. The suspected abductors are the Nyatura.

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On May 26, a student was kidnapped from Busanza, when he was going to school in Nyarukwangara. His kidnappers demanded a ransom. The suspected assailants are the FDLR/Rudi.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On May 27, NDC-Guidon assailants kidnapped civilians from Karambi village.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On May 27, the NDC Guidon attacked the Mazembe in Lubero village. 3 NDC rebels were killed and another 4 injured. One Mazembe was injured and the NDC looted several goods, burning down part of the Mazembe camp.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 27, unidentified armed men killed a shepherd in Burungu.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On May 27, the NDC Guidon attacked the APCLS in Buboa village, Masisi. 2 APCLS combatants were killed and 2 NDC combatants injured.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On May 27, the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin shot two traders in Lukaraba village, Walikale. One person was killed on the spot and the other remained injured because they refused to carry the assailants' belongings.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 27, a policeman shot another policeman during a security check in Kiondo. The policeman died.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Between May 24 and 27, the FRPI clashed with the FARDC in the chiefdom of Walendu Bindi, in Irumu, a couple km from Aveba.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: CCU: United Congolese Convention; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 27, a radio close to the Party of the People for Reconstruction and Democracy (Parti du Peuple pour la Reconstruction et la Democratie) was set on fire by alleged CCU members (Convention of the United Congolese). Two CCU arrested.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Looting: Between 28 May-24 June, suspected Batwa militiamen armed with arrows ambushed vehicles on 3 occasions along the Kalemie-Kabwela axis. The ambushes were meant to steal goods. Two NGO vehicles were targeted while on one occasion, one person was abducted for a few hours. Coded as three separate events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 28, the FARDC arrested and killed two men on the spot whom they accused of belonging to the Mayi Mayi, in Kyangolo village, Beni.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 28, unidentified armed men killed a woman in Kitchanga, Masisi.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 28, the FARDC were attacked by the Mayi Mayi in Isale, Lubero. 2 rebels were neutralised.

column6: UNMAS: United Nations Mine Action Service
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: Security Measures: with support from the government of Japan and MONUSCO, the UNMAS installed weapon safes in many police commissariats and sub-commissariats across DRC. A total of 227 safes were installed, including 93 in Goma (North Kivu), 31 in Bukavu and Uvira (South Kivu), 73 in Bunia (Ituri), 24 in Kananga (Kasai Central) and 56 in Kinshasa.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column7: Hunde Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 28, the APCLS (with Hunde allegiance) killed a woman in Kitshanga. This attack comes after 4 people were kidnapped by the Nyatura (with Hutu allegiance) on May 26. The woman in question was the mother of a Nyatura combatant, and her abduction was a reprisal to the previous attack. Many people left the region due to fear of retaliation.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 29, unidentified men stopped and kidnapped two motorcycle riders in Kibingu village. A ransom was demanded but the civilians managed to escape.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 29, unidentified armed men broke into a house in Chabingili village, Rutshuru, and kidnapped 2 men and one boy, demanding a ransom for their release.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 29, unidentified gunmen abducted 3 people in Kabasha village, Beni.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On May 29, the APCLS clashed with the NDC in Lukweti and Kalungu, in Masisi, due to the dispute of territorial control of the villages between Masisi and Walikale. There was 1 death and some wounded people on the ACPLS side, and some more wounded on the NDC side.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around 29 May 2018 (as reported), two bodies of FARDC soldiers were found at Mankungwe village in Kyangolo commune, Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC reported that they were killed during combat with a Mayi Mayi militia.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On May 29, the APCLS clashed with the NDC in Lukweti and Kalungu, in Masisi, due to the dispute of territorial control of the villages between Masisi and Walikale. There was 1 death and some wounded people on the ACPLS side, and some more wounded on the NDC side.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On May 30, the NDC-Guidon attacked the Mazembe in Pitakongo village, Lubero. Three NDC-G rebels died and one was injured; one Mazembe was injured. The NDC-Guidon burned down the Mayi Mayi Mazembe camp.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 30, unidentified armed men shot and killed a woman through the window of her house in Bwinyole neighbourhood of Butembo.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Arrests: On May 31, 3 Ugandan soldiers crossed into DRC through Tako village, in Beni. They were chased by civilians, who captured 1 of them and handed him to the Kasindi rural commune.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 31, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man in Ilange village, Beni. They demanded a ransom for his release.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 31, unidentified gunmen attacked the police station in Bulengera.3 policemen were killed and 8 AK47 weapons stolen.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On May 31, FDLR-RUD tried to rape a girl in Rusaka I village, Rutshuru. They shot the brother and injured the mom of the girl with a machete. The boy died due to injuries and the girl was abducted and taken to the woods.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On May 31, a peaceful protest by people demonstrating against insecurity in the area ended with 16 militants arrested in Rutshuru.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On May 31, armed men attacked the police station in Butembo, killing 3 policemen and a civilian. On the same day, unidentified men burned the nearby road toll office in Kunguta village on the Butembo-Bulambo road.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Towards the end of May, three locations were retaken by the government close to Lake Edward: the bays of Kafuzo, Kamuhororo and Kibahari (approximate coordinates used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera). Three events coded at 20, 25 and 31 May. Approximate locations used for Kafunzo and Kamohorera.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: PND: National Party for Democracy and Development
column17: Looting: On May 31, the headquarter of the National Party for Democracy and Development (PND) was pillaged.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
column17: On June 1, the Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted a 40 year old woman from Mugerero village, Uvira. The FARDC intervened after being alerted by the population but did not manage to stop them.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 June, near Banda, an unidentified armed group entered a camp of Peuhl pastoralists and kidnapped children. Peuhl families were displaced towards Banda to alert authorities.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 1 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked a FARDC position in Kokola (Beni, Nord-Kivu), an area with a primary school in full session with gunshots ringing. One ADF fighter is reported killed and an ADF minor (12 years old) was captured after being badly injured by a gunshot to the knees. On the FARDC side, 1 soldier died and two others were injured. ADF raided supplies of trading houses in the area. An Actros branded vehicle was burned down.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On June 1, the APCLS attacked the village of Buhambi, in Kitshanga. They killed 3 people, of which two minors aged 13 and 14. 3 assailants were later arrested in Kitshanga.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 2, the FARDC attacked an unidentified armed group who had raided Bushumba village. During the clash, 4 civilians were wounded and two assailants captured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
column17: On June 2, the Mayi Mayi Kilalo attacked the Lyakobo neighbourhood in Beni. The FARDC managed to repel the rebels, but the clash led to 5 rebels dead as well as a 5 year old boy and a woman.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Arrests: On June 2, 50 people were arrested under operation Tujikinge in Uvira. 9 firearms were also seized.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 June 2018, a PNC office was targeted by two FARDC soldiers in Ngongo district of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They were arrested.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 2 June 2018, Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked the FONER office and FARDC position in Mukulia village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), burning the office down. Two soldiers were wounded and one militiaman was captured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 2, the radio Grand Tam-Tam from Lodja was pillaged. The emission is currently down. The assailants destroyed material, stole some, and beat up a human rights activist that was finishing an emission.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On June 2, the Mayi Mayi attacked Mukulya, in the Beni-Butembo axis, and killed 3 people, injuring another two. The assailants also burned the FONER office. A later report by the same source mentions 6 dead and 2 soldiers wounded, as well as 10 cows stolen which were later recovered.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 4, civil servants protested in front of the MONUSCO office in Mbandaka to reclaim their salaries. This happened because the bank that usually pays their salaries did not deploy people to make those payments due to fear of their employees being at risk of getting Ebola.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On 4 June 2018, armed men affiliated with a Mayi Mayi militia erected a camp between Kalunguta and Kasitu villages in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu) northeast of Butembo. Farmers in the area were now only allowed to work on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays and were charged a payment of almonds, a sack of cassava flour, a goat and 20L of local beer.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 4, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked the FARDC position in Mighobwe village, Lubero, forcing the FARDC to abandon it. Two FARDC were shot and wounded; the Mazembe burned down 6 houses and the Kyaghanda Yira (an ethnic community organization) meeting place.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On June 4, the ADF attacked in the Beni-Kasindi axis and killed a civilian. Ambushes like this have been perpetrated by a Mayi Mayi-ADF coalition.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 4 June 2018, ADF clashed with the FARDC in Kitchanga village, between Semuliki bridge and Nyaleke (Beni, Nord-Kivu). A FUSO car carrying beans coming from Kasindi was set on fire and a taximan was shot and died. The driver of the car was also hospitalized in a critical condition.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 June 2018, a bomb fell on the roof of a post office next to the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The damage was enormous on the side of the roads and surrounding houses. No fatalities or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 5, a Hutu communal chief was killed by an unidentified armed group when he was leaving from Nyanzale to Goma.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 5, taxi men rioted and chased policemen on the avenue of Kisangani.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On the week of June 4-8, inhabitants of the chiefdom of Bukumu, in Nyiarongo protested to get the local authorities to put their customary chief in command.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Agreement: On June 6, 3 LRA rebels surrendered in the forest in Banda.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 6, taxi men continued to protest the presence of policemen in Kisangani by chating songs, honking horns and dragging tree leaves down the street.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 7 June 2018, ADF shot and killed a nurse, set his motorcycle on fire and stole the stock of medications he was transporting between Bunake to Kainama in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 7 June 2018 (between 7 - 8 June), unknown armed men threatened the life of a man and then abducted his wife in Mangina village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), they are now demanding a ransom.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 7 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels kidnapped palm oil merchants traveling from Oicha to Kainama just before they reached Eringeti (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 8, inhabitants of the chiefdom of Bukumu, in Nyiarongo protested, as they had already done during the week, to get the local authorities to put their customary chief in command. Clashes ensued between the police and protesters, who were carrying live bullets but did not allegedly intend to use them during the protest. The police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 8, 6 people were killed by an armed group in the grouping of Bijombo.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Makabe)
column17: On the night of June 9-10, local militiamen headed by warlord Makabe attacked the villagers of Mpela, grouping of Kisula, in Malemba Nkulu. 2 people reportedly killed and 48 houses burned.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column16: Radio Okapi; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 9, presumed ADF militants launched an incursion in Ngite. They first burned 5 houses and some stalls, before clashing with the FARDC. 2 soldiers killed. 5 people were injured and reportedly one person died from the side effects of the violence (from hypertension due to the loud noises caused by the first explosions of the attack).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Beni Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 10, an unidentified group tried to break into a house in Malepe neighbourhood, Beni. The police intervened and repelled them.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 10, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) in Busurungi. Clashes spread to other areas the following day. 8 people killed in total including 7 on the second day. The Ngendo faction leader, Shalio was among the casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 10 June. Military forces set fire to a home and killed a civilian election worker with LUCHA, in Goma, Nord-Kivu. The military claimed accidental causes for the death.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 10 June 2018, a group of unknown armed men kidnapped a man in his home in Mataba village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and took him to an unknown destination.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: Recruitment: report of growing influence of the NDC-Renewal militia in and around Walikale and Lubero in areas where the FARDC are absent. The group counts 1.200-1.250 active combatants in several locations (large parts of Walikale, a non-negligeable part of the Lubero and less extensive parts of Rutshuru and Masisi). Certain testimonies mention an alleged strategy between the FARDC and the NDC-R, coordinated through talks.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 10 June. LUCHA leader's, Luc Nkulula, home caught fire in Goma, DRC. Officials said the fire was accidental, while activist contend it was intentionally set on fire.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 11, unidentified armed men shot and killed a man, a woman and their two children in Kajembe village, Uvira territory

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 11, unidentified gunmen killed a man in Kilungu village, Walikale territory.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 11, unidentified armed men broke into Lukorwe village, in Nyiarongo, injured three people and kidnapped a man.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 11, the FARDC clashed with a group who was trying to steal cows in Ngandjo, Kalehe. One soldier was injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 11, an unidentified armed group looted goods and kidnapped 3 people from Kanyabayonga.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around June 11, the FARDC recovered three territories from the Mayi Mayi in Rutshuru, south of Lake Edward: Kafuzo, Kamuhororo, and Kibahari and freed 7 hostages (including 4 of the 20 Ugandan fishermen kidnapped on May 20).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around June 11, the FARDC recovered three territories from the Mayi Mayi in Rutshuru, south of Lake Edward: Kafuzo, Kamuhororo, and Kibahari and freed 7 hostages (including 4 of the 20 Ugandan fishermen kidnapped on May 20).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Looting: The MSF team was once more ambushed and robbed along the Masisi-Nyabiondo axis. This is the second such attack in a month and the seventh in Masisi since the beginning of the year. MSF suspended its hygiene assistance in the area as a result.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 12, a policeman got into a fight with a civilian in a bar in Kalehe. He pushed the civilian against a tree and the victim died from the injuries.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 12, a 23 year old man was killed by men in military uniform in Rugenge, leading to clashes between protesters and police the following day.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 June, near Digba, 3 unidentified armed men in military attire ambushed 4 fishermen. One of the fishermen was injured but escaped to Digba. Two others were abducted.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 12 June 2018, a Mayi Mayi militia attacked and set on fire FARDC barracks located in Maboya village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The barracks was unoccupied at the time.

column6: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: On June 12, the NDC Guidon and the CNRD clashed in Kinyabwitsi, Walikale territory. 2 CNRD and 1 NDC Guidon died.

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On June 13, 13 people were kidnapped by the FDLR-Rude in Kibingu and Kibirizi. In Kibingu, 8 people were kidnapped.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 13, in response to the killing of a civilian the day before by men in military uniform, youth barricaded routes in Uvira, denouncing the insecurity in the locality. The riot was interrupted by security forces and 2 people were injured (one civilian injured by tear gas, one policeman by pelted stones).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 13, an argument between a police officer and a civilian over the candidacy of Vital Kamerhe in Walungu led the police officer to shoot the civilian, who died. After the incident, residents gathered and killed the policeman.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 13, an argument between a police officer and a civilian over the candidacy of Vital Kamerhe in Walungu led the police officer to shoot the civilian, who died. After the incident, residents gathered and killed the policeman.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 13, unidentified men shot a civilian through a window in Kangalamuka village, Lubero. The civilian died.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column17: On June 13, the Mayi Mayi Kirikicho attached the Kifuafua Delphin in Biriku village, Walikale, following the killing of the commander Shario. 2 Kifuafua and 3 Kirikicho were killed, and 3 Kifuafua were injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 13, unidentified armen men kidnapped a child from Virunga neighbourhood in Goma.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 13, unidentified armed men killed a civilian in Malolu village, Beni.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 June 2018, a Tanzanian man who had been forcibly nlisted by the ADF was detained by the villagers in Ngite (Beni, Nord-Kivu), who then took him to the relevant authorities. [size=no report]

column6: FDLR-Rude: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Rude Faction)
column17: On June 13, 13 people were kidnapped by the FDLR-Rude in Kibingu and Kibirizi. In Kibingu, 8 people were kidnapped.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction; Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
column17: On June 14, a coalition of Mayi Mayi Kifuafua of Shario Ngendo, Kirikicho and Shukuru attacked the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin after the death of Shario. The clashes took place in Busurungi, Biriko, Kifuruka, Bunyamwerimba and Kilamba villages in Walikale territory.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 14, the Nyatura Domi attacked the FARDC in Katendere, killing one soldier and stealing his weapon.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 14, the ADF attacked the FARDC position in Mabakweli village, Beni, killing a soldier, burning the FARDC camp and abducting eight civilians.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
