column17: On June 14, a policeman had an argument with a policewoman over her lack of respect for the police commander. A bullet was shot and the police commander died on the spot.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction; Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
column17: On June 14, a coalition of Mayi Mayi Kifuafua of Shario Ngendo, Kirikicho and Shukuru attacked the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin after the death of Shario. The clashes took place in Busurungi, Biriko, Kifuruka, Bunyamwerimba and Kilamba villages in Walikale territory.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction; Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
column17: On June 14, a coalition of Mayi Mayi Kifuafua of Shario Ngendo, Kirikicho and Shukuru attacked the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin after the death of Shario. The clashes took place in Busurungi, Biriko, Kifuruka, Bunyamwerimba and Kilamba villages in Walikale territory.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction; Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
column17: On June 14, a coalition of Mayi Mayi Kifuafua of Shario Ngendo, Kirikicho and Shukuru attacked the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua Delphin after the death of Shario. The clashes took place in Busurungi, Biriko, Kifuruka, Bunyamwerimba and Kilamba villages in Walikale territory.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Looting: On June 14, unidentified men looted goods and stole animals in Nduma village, forcing civilians to carry some of the goods.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kirikicho)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction; Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 June 2018, three FARDC soldiers intimidated a farmer on his plot in Tenambo village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and robbed him of 60,000 Francs, a television set and a battery. The FARDC also took 300,00 Francs from two taximen.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 14 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked locals living near a FARDC position on the Mabatili river along the Bilimani-Tenambo route (Beni, Nord-Kivu). A woman was shot dead, while another woman and her daughter were abducted.

column6: NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo
column17: Around 14 June 2018 (between 14 - 15 June), the NDC arrived at Kalunguta village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and abducted 8 people, 4 of whom were subsequently liberated, and headed towards Pabuka.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: Between June 13-17, 30 fishermen were kidnapped by the Mayi Mayi in Lubero and Rutshuru. They were later released after the payment of 100 USD for each. They had been kidnapped near Tshanika and Ndwali, south-west of Lake Edward.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Agreement: Around 60 children left the FRPI group in Ituri between April-June 2018.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 15, unidentified armed men kidnapped a 48 year old man in Munigi and then killed him.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
column17: On June 15, the Raia Mutomboki raided the Ngolombe village, in Shabunda, stealing several goods and kidnapping 6 men.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 15, a police patrol confronted an armed group who was trying to rob a house in Mutiri neighbourhood of Butembo. One armed men was killed, and the police seized an AK-47, motorcycles and other goods.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 15, the Mayi Mayi ambushed a SNCC train close to Malela, in Kasongo. The militia took eight hostages: 6 soldiers and 2 train drivers.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Property destruction: On June 14, unidentified militiamen killed dozens of cattle in Lukopfu; 100 were killed in the locality over two weeks.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: Between June 13-17, 30 fishermen were kidnapped by the Mayi Mayi in Lubero and Rutshuru. They were later released after the payment of 100 USD for each. They had been kidnapped near Tshanika and Ndwali, south-west of Lake Edward.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Change to armed group: Several FARDC soldiers have abandoned their posts to become miners or perform other jobs in Banalia. It is reported that some of them force civilians to work for them and their presence in uniforms is causing insecurity.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 16 June. Suspected police officers in civilian clothing detained four men in the Yolo neighborhood of Kalamu. The next day the bodies of two of the detainees were dumped in Yolo and the other two bodies were discovered in the Mingadi neighborhood of Kinshasa. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 16, a soldier killed a civilian in the village of Kakamba, in Kazumba, when they were disputing a debt. Several other soldiers burned houses down.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 16, unidentified armed men attacked Ruzirantaka, in Masisi, and killed 2 soldiers.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 16, a soldier killed a civilian in the village of Kakamba, in Kazumba, when they were disputing a debt. The civilian's family subsequently seized the soldier and beat him to death.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Rwanda)
column8: Bafuliru Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: Over a few days before June 19, several battles took place close to Bijombo, between the Banyamulenge allegedly supported by a group of Rwandan gunmen coming from Fizi and a coalition of Bafuliru, Banyindu and Babembe. Around a dozen people were killed, including civilians and militia members. Three days of violence coded between June 16-18.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 17,in Bubanga, close to Rutshuru, unidentified gunmen killed 2 young men.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 17, armed men broke into Brazza village, in Masisi, and killed a man and his wife.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 17, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in Ntamugenga, 10km from Rutshuru on the road to Goma (approx. coordinates used), and kidnapped a 5 year old child.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 17, the FARDC shelled alleged ADF positions in Mamundioma village, Beni.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 17, unidentified armed men killed a girl in Kibumba village, Nyiragongo.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 17, the FARDC arrested a man suspected of collaborating with the Nyatura in Kigarama village. Not being able to prove it, they had to release him, but 2 soldiers shot him in the leg and he died.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 17 June. During the night, police officers apprehended two males and a teenager in the Yolo South neighborhood of Kalamu. The next day the bodies of the three detainees were found. The genitals had been cut off of at least two of the victims. The attacks are believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 17 June. Suspected police officers apprehended a 16 year-old in the Mombele neighborhood of Limete. The teenager's naked body was later discovered. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column7: Unidentified Armed Group (Rwanda)

column17: Around 19 June, in the context of clashes n the Bijmbo area, coalition of Bafuliru, Banyindu and Babembe established a base in Masango, with the help of another Burundian armed group.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: On 18 June 2018, an unidentified armed group tried to enter a home in Malepe district of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and one was shot dead by law enforcement officers standing guard.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 19, the Mayi Mayi Shalio attacked the Kifuafua Dephin in Kahunju, Walikale, and the Delphin captured 2 Shalio rebels.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 19, unidentified gunmen arrested a policewoman as she was entering her house, in Buturande neighbourhood of Kiwanja. The policewoman's husband, who is also a policeman, shot fires into the air, but the rebels captured the policewoman.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 19, an unidentified group attacked a FARDC group who was in a mini bus close to Mighobwe village, in Lubero. A FARDC soldier was injured.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 19, the APCLS battled with an unidentified group in Ngingwe village. A 12 year old was killed.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: On June 20, the Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin shot and killed one of the two Mai-Mai Shalio that had been captured close to Kahunju village, in Walikale.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 20, a member of the police got into a dispute with some people on the board of the SNCC train, in Muleba, firing shots after the altercation. 2 people were the targets of lost bullets and died. After the incident, the population of Muleba gathered and burned him alive, and fled the village after in fear of reprisals.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 20, a member of the police got into a dispute with some people on the board of the SNCC train, in Muleba, firing shots after the altercation. 2 people were the targets of lost bullets and died. After the incident, the population of Muleba gathered and burned him alive, and fled the village after in fear of reprisals.

column17: On June 20, unidentified gunmen assaulted a motorcycle in Mapera, Kayna, and kidnapped 3 people.

column6: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Looting: On June 20, the offices of the Radio television Boma were looted by unknown assailants.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 20, the FARDC were attacked by the NDC Guidon when they were patrolling in Walikale. One NDC Guidon and 2 civilians were injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: On June 21, the Mayi Mayi Mazembe ambushed the FARDC in Kalunguta village, Beni, when they were moving from Butembo. 5 soldiers were injured during the attack.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 21, unidentified men broke into a house in Kasenyi village, Nyiragongo, and killed a man.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 21, unidentified men killed a Rwandan woman in Vubiro village, Nyiragonongo.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On the night of June 21, the FRPI attacked Kombokabo, 23 km away from Bunia. They looted goods and stole animals, injuring a civilian as well.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 21 June. Police apprehended four men in the Ngomba neighborhood of Kisenso. The bodies of three of the men were found the following morning, the other man was disappeared. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On 21 June 2018, a presumed Mayi Mayi militia attacked merchants and other civilians on route N40 at Kalunguta village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). There are no details provided on fatalities or injuries.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 21, a student was killed by unidentified armed men in the commune of Kimeni, in Butembo.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 21 June 2018, presumed ADF rebels clashed with the FARDC after launching an ambush in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Fatalities and injuries are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 22, unidentified gunmen ambushed a vehicle carrying a FARDC soldier close to Chamiloge, in Kalehe. The attackers killed the driver and injured the FARDC soldier.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Vikwazo)
column17: Looting: On June 22, Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki Vunja Vikwazo raided Mitala, in Shabunda, looting goods. They also forced civilians to carry some of these goods.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo); Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 22 June. Police arrested a suspected robber in the Ngomba neighborhood of Kisenso. His body was found a few hours later near the place of his arrest. Angry residents then set fire to the body.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On the night of June 22, unidentified armed men killed a police commander in Burungu, Masisi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 22 June, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], 7 unidentified armed men in robes looted 10 civilians of their phones, clothes, and food. The victims, who were released hours later, alerted authorities who arrested 6 Peuhls and the wife of a recognized assailant from Ango for interrogation.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 22, students took to the streets of Butembo to protest the killing of another student the night before.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 23, following the kidnapping of three men in Kayna three days prior, the hostage's families handed over the first part of the ransom. When they were delivering the second, the FARDC opened fire upont the assailants, who escaped into Virunga park. The FARDC recovered the three hostages.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 23, protesters took to the streets in Lugendo to demonstrate against the bad management in their grouping, and specifically in regards to the insecurity in the region.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 June, near Digba, a man and his young daughter were found dead in their field. The girl appeared to have been beaten to death, and the father was shot in the neck. A hunting rifle was found lying against the man's body.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 24, unidentified gunmen killed a man in Majengo neighbourhood, in Goma.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On June 24, the Twiganeho and Ngumino raided the villages of Nyogomberwa, Runywera, Bijingi, Namurambagira in Uvira, and burned 80 houses.

column6: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: On June 24, the CNRD kidnapped three young boys from Katsiru village, brought them to their camp and then killed them.

column6: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: On June 24, the CNRD killed a 43 year old man in Kalembe village.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Between 28 May-24 June, suspected Batwa militiamen armed with arrows ambushed vehicles on 3 occasions along the Kalemie-Kabwela axis. The ambushes were meant to steal goods. Two NGO vehicles were targeted while on one occasion, one person was abducted for a few hours. Coded as three separate events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On June 25, the Mayi Mayi Charles attacked the FARDC position in Kafunzo. They killed 16 FARDC soldiers and stole some weapons.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On June 25, the FDLR-RUD kidnapped a man on the Kinyandonyi-Busanza road, close to Maserege village, in Rutshuru. They demanded a ransom for his release.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 25 June. Suspected police officers apprehended a man in Mombele, Limete. His body was later found. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column17: On 25 June 2018, Mayi Mayi Mazembe made an incursion into the village of Mambale in Kalunguta region (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killing two men, including an ANR agent. ANR and PNC offices were burned.

column7: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi)

column17: On June 27, the CNRD killed a man in Katsiru village.

column8: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kyakwama)

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: On July 24, the FARDC attacked the Mai-Mai Simba in the Bongisa mining site, Walikale territory. This attack left one dead and two wounded in the ranks of Mai-Mai Simba, and two wounded on the FARDC side.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On July 24, youth from the Bankoko neighborhood in Bunia set fire to the ""City of Refuge"" church building to protest their ""excessive"" sermons and practices. Police fired shots in the air to disperse them.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Domi Faction

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 26 July 2018, ADF rebels raided Kithevya village in Bakila Tenambo district (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killing one civilian.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 2 August 2018, thirteen farmers were kidnapped by ADF rebels from their field in Mayangose village just outside Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). One farmer alerted the FARDC who tried unsuccessfully to pursue the attackers. The following Tuesday on 7 August fourteen lifeless decaying bodies were found and presumed to be those abducted who were earlier abducted. The assailants reportedly took with them 3 children after killing the adults.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 2 Aug 2018, unidentified gunmen raided the villages of Kabushwa, Mabingu and Mantu in Kabare territory [coded as 2 separate events]. The attackers killed a man and wounded a teenager. They also looted property.

column17: ""Seven UN local implementing partners were abducted in North Kivu on August 2nd, 2018. The convoy of two vehicles was stopped by armed assailants East of Masisi center. The Congolese nationals were kidnapped but the two drivers and their vehicles were released. On August 3rd, two of the seven staff members were released after being seriously assaulted. They were treated for their wounds in Masisi. Reportedly a ransom has been requested for the remaining staff members.""

His son accompanied by FARDC soldiers went to look, but the body was found already lying on the ground decapitated. The son was also shot and killed as he was in front of the team. No clash reported.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale)
column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent;  Aid Workers (Central African Republic)
column17: On August 19, four employees of the Red Cross have been kidnapped by a group of Hapa Na Pale Mayi Mayi militants in Tanganyika province. The incident occurred in Mponda Luganza, within Kongolo territory.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 19 August 2018. A man was killed near the Shari River, 7 km from Irumu, by suspected FRPI combatants.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale)
column9: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: ""Four members of the Red Cross were reportedly kidnapped in Katanga state, Tanganyika province, by a group of Hapa Na Pale Mayi Mayi militants. It is unknown whether the members have been released.""

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 20 August. An unidentified armed group attacked Mapobu, Beni. No further details available.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 20 August 2018. During the night, the body of a man, who appeared to have been tortured, was discovered in Komanda, Irumu. According to civil society organizations, the FRPI was responsible for the attack.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 20 August. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Kasinga, Beni. Three soldiers were killed and one was injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Between 21 and 27 August. An unidentified armed group abducted a civilian working for a human rights NGO near Mutarule and Luberizi villages, Uvira. The civilian was found dead 6 days later.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 21 August 2018 (as reported), an unidentified armed group abducted four people from Lyakobo neighbourhood in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua-Mbaenda)
column17: On 21 Aug 2018, the Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda tortured a man in Malembe village of Walikale territory, accusing him of non-payment of a debt to a local commander. The victim succumbed to his injuries.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Domi Faction
column17: On 21 Aug 2018, the Nyatura Domi, while attempting to capture a CNRD combatant in Katsiru village in Rutshuru territory, shot and killed a teenage girl.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On or before 21 August. The police tortured a man arrested for kidnapping in the rural commune of Kasindi. The victim died of his injuries in jail.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 22 August 2018 (between 22 - 23 August), a chief of the Kilikoma cell in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) was kidnapped by presumed Mayi Mayi militiamen and then driven towards Kalingathe. They also took money, goat and a telephone. He was released after being tortured by his captors.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 22 August 2018 (on or around). During the week, a man was killed in Subega, Irumu (no coordinates available) by suspected FRPI combatants, according to local CSOs.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 22 August 2018, a motorcycle taxi driver and his client were ambushed and killed by ADF rebels in Mukoko village in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 23 August. An unidentified armed group abducted two civilians from Kitchanga, Rutshuru.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change
column17: 23 August 2018. A group of LUCHA activist held a demonstration in Kananga, calling for the removal of the provincial governor over accusation of mismanagement. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 August 2018, a taxi driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men after returning from a funeral in Kasindi-Lubiriha (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On 23 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked a FARDC position , supported by MONUSCO, in Mukoko village of Beni territory. Two people were killed.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 23 Aug 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and killed a man in Tchampundu village of Shabunda territory.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 24 August 2018, young people barricaded all the entrances to the area in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), in response to an FARDC soldier shooting and killing a telephone vendor. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 August. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified group, between Jericho and Makembi - near Eringeti. One soldier was killed.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 August 2018, taxi drivers stormed the offices of delegated officials and burned them in demonstration in Kasindi-Lubiriha (Beni, Nord-Kivu), the day after a taximan was killed. [size=no report]

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 24 August. RED-Tabara clashed with an unknown group in Katoki/Katanga in the Bijombo groupement. Casualities not known.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 24 Aug 2018, an FARDC soldier accidentally shot a civilian woman in Sange rural commune of Rutanga district. The victim succumbed to her wounds.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 24 Aug 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and killed a 26-year-old man in Kalinda neighborhood of Beni city. The soldier was arrested by a patrol.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 August 2018, presumed ADF rebels attacked the FARDC base in Ngadi village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) causing panic in the locals, who fled for Beni. Seventeen soldiers, including a major, and one civilian were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Angola (1975-)
column17: 25 August 2018. Two Angolan soldiers raped a woman in the bush in Kamako. Police intervened and captured one assailant, while the other fled across the border.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 August 2018, taxi drivers demolished the house of the suspect (and neighbour of victim) in the poisoning death of an 18 year-old taxi man in Irango village 7km from Mabalako (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The police arrived to secure and calm the situation. [size=no report]

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: PALU: Unified Lumumbist Party
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 25 August. Five people were wounded after supporters of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) who had come down to ransack their party headquarters in Gungu clashed with the police in Gungu. This followed the invalidation of Antoine Gizenga's and Muzito's files in the next presidential election.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: PALU: Unified Lumumbist Party
column17: On August 25, members of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) demonstrated in Gungu city, capital of Kwilu territory, against the inadmissibility of the candidacies of Antoine Gizenga and Adolphe Muzito in upcoming elections in that territory.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 26 August 2018 (between 26 - 27 August), locals in Oicha detained an alleged ADF militant who had four knives and two machetes on him in Oicha city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and handed him over to local military authorities. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 August 2018. An unidentified armed group ambushed two men - including a journalist - in the Rutshuru territory. The assailants assaulted one of the men before abducting the journalist.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 August 2018, unknown armed men raided a farm on the Beni-Butembo route in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu), abducting a man, and taking several hundred animals.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 August 2018. Two FARDC soldiers were ambushed and beheaded by Lendu militias in Ladejo or Wassa, Djugu. Another source reported the location as Wassa.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 August. FARDC looted Lendu civilians in Djailo

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Lendu Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 August. FARDC looted Lendu civilians in Loko

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: 27 August. The militiamen of the Nduma defence of Congo (NDC / Renove) movement attacked the Mai-Mai Mazembe in the Pitakongo village in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu). NDC won after a 2h battle. Some dead and wounded reported. The village had been under Mazembe control for the last three years. Unknown casualties coded as 5.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: 27 August. 21 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 27 August - on or about. Elements of the NDC / Renove tried to enter the agglomeration of Kasugho in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu) but were repulsed by the army. At least 4 of their elements were killed and another captured.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 27 August 2018. An angry mob attacked the health center and police station in Bela. The riot occurred after the death of a woman who had been transferred to an Ebola center in another town. Police intervened and fired shots to disperse the demonstrators. Two police officers were injured. [size=no report]

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: On 29 Aug 2018, the NDC-R shot and killed a man in Mera village in North Kivu territory. The attackers suspected the victim to be an NDC Sheka informant.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 29 Aug 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a 24-year-old man in Tinge village in Beni territory. They accused the victim of being a Mai-Mai.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: 29 August. The vice president of the youth of the locality of Mera in the territory of Walikale (North Kivu) was murdered by alleged Mai-Mai fighters of the NDC-Renovated Mwissa Shirirayi, aka Guidon in Kibua.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 29 August 2018, a man was assassinated by unknown armed men, who then looted his shop in Tinge district in Maboya (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Some sources suggest that elements of the FARDC were the perpetrators.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column16: Radio Okapi; UN (unspecified); Kivu Security Tracker
column17: 30 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. The five civilian fatalities reportedly occurred in Kakuka. One person was also raped and 2 others were injured. It is unclear in which town(s) the confrontation with the soldier and rape occurred - these were spread across event locations.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 30 or 31 August. An unidentified armed group attacked Masuluwede (no coordinates available), near Ngite. One civilian was injured.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column9: Mayimoya Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 30 August 2018, a Mayi Mayi militia attempted to assassinate the chief of Liva locality in Mayimoya (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They entered his house and attacked him with a machete before fleeing. He was hospitalized following the attack.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 30 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked FARDC positions in Kinyamubiri in Beni territory. The clashes lasted over twelve hours. Two men were wounded.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 30 or 31 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. The five civilian fatalities reportedly occurred in Kakuka. One person was also raped and 2 others were injured. It is unclear in which town(s) the confrontation with the soldier and rape occurred - these were spread across event locations.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 30 or 31 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. The five civilian fatalities reportedly occurred in Kakuka. One person was also raped and 2 others were injured. It is unclear in which town(s) the confrontation with the soldier and rape occurred - these were spread across event locations.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: 31 August. Five people were killed by suspected ADF rebels in Kakuka at the border with Ituri.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: 31 August. 18 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column7: FDP: Federal Democratic Party
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 1 Sept 2018, the Nyatura FDP and FDLR-FOCA attacked an FARDC position in Machazo village of Rutshuru territory. One civilian was killed while two FARDC soldiers and three civilians were wounded. Looting of civilian property also occurred.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 September 2018, a woman was abducted from her home by unknown armed men in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 September 2018, a woman allegedly affiliated with the ADF was captured by locals in Kitevya village in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and brought to the nearest military authorities. [size=no report]

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: EPC: Together for Change
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 01 September 2018. Police forces intervened in a Together for Change political rally in Lubumbashi. One person was killed and at least nine others were arrested. [size=no report]

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
column17: 01 September. Militants of the Mouvement de liberation du Congo and those of the Common Front for Congo (FCC) threw stones at each other and clashed as they gathered to greet their respective delegations at the Gemena airport (South Ubangi). The MLC militants began throwing stones at the FCC ones after learning that their delegation would not land in Gemena.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 2 September, an LRA group of 5 men and 3 boys in military and civilian attire, ambushed civilians in a field 4 km northeast of Kpegu. They looted the victims and abducted 2 men and 1 girl.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 2 September, near Dikumba, 20 LRA members looted houses and abducted 1 man and 2 girls. They released the man 12 km northwest of Dikuma later that day. The 2 girls remain unaccounted for and presumed in captivity.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
column17: 02 September 2018. Mayi Mayi Simba attacked the Nia Nia mines. Three people were killed. The assailants looted goods and abducted civilians to carry the goods. The abductees were later released.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Love)
column8: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Love)
column8: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column9: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 3 September, in Mugalie, an LRA group looted a Peuhl campsite of the food, money, and other goods.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 03 September. An unidentified armed group ambushed a MONUSCO convoy along the Mavivi-Boikene road. Two peacekeepers were injured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On or before 03 September. The FARDC attacked unidentified gunmen who wanted to occupy the Luziba mine site in Lumbishi village in Kalehe territory.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03 September. Fifteen activists from the Citizen's Struggle for Change movement (LUCHA) were wounded and admitted to the hospital as police dispersed a march initiated by the movement in Goma. During the demonstration, three local journalists were assaulted by the police.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 03 September. Two MONUSCO peacekeepers, two soldiers and two civilians were injured during an ADF ambush in the Ngadi area. Two civilians were also abducted but later escaped.

column6: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 03 September. The ADF attacked a FARDC position in Ngadi, about 12 km from the centre of Beni city near the Rwenzori forest but they were repelled. Loyalist forces repelled them after violent clashes. Civil society claims that several assets of the population were looted by the alleged ADF during this attack.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kilalo)
column17: On 4 September 2018, a woman was kidnapped by Mayi Mayi Kilalo militia from Mabata (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to the east of the location.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: 05 September. Clashes between the FARDC and Nyatura fighters left at least two civilians killed and five seriously injured in the town of Rugari, Rutshuru territory, North Kivu. Among the wounded, there are two soldiers. Later reports indicate four fatalities. The military indicated that the assailants were FDLR fighters, not Nyatura combatants.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 06 September 2018. A suspected robber was caught and lynched by a mob in Matadi.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 07 September 2018. The FRPI looted Banikonza, Bandikama and Batine, Ituri (no coordinates available, located next to Nyakunde town).

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Binakwa)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 7 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a man in Kakomero village of Rutshuru territory. The FARDC suspected the victim from being a Nyatura fighter.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
column17: 08-09 September. Masudi Alimasi Kokodikoko's Raia Mutomboki forces abducted seventeen women and girls (age 15-70) in the Shabunda territory. The group then held the women in a cave for four days, where they subjected them to rape and other forms of sexual violence. Kokodikoko raped at least nine of the women.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 September 2018, unknown armed men abducted a woman in Mangina commune (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Bakwa Ndaye Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Unidentified Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 09 September 2018 (on or around). During the weekend, communal tensions broke out in the Katende area, as Bakwa Ndaye assaulted over 50 members of a different ethnic group. Five houses, as well as other property, was destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 September. Republican Guard soldier was arrested for shooting a civilian at the public port of Goma (North Kivu). The victim was shot and wounded as he opened the door from his home to answer the call of soldiers. Motives unknown.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Matembo. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Mavivi, Oicha. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
column17: 09 September. Police shoot and member of the National Intelligence Agency in Bendera during an altercation.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On 9 September 2018, alleged ADF rebels raided and took over the area surrounding the MONUSCO camp in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC engaged in a firefight with them, incentivizing the locals to seek refuge in Oicha and other neighbourhoods in the city. No fatalities or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: 10 September. The Armed Forces of the DRC deployed a unit in Butale. The deployment is due to a recent visit of an area chief

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 12 September, near Bangadi, 6 armed LRA combatants looted 2 cyclists and 1 doctor of their money, vaccines, and other goods along the Nambia Ngbangala-Bangadi road. They also kidnapped 3 men and 1 young boy, releasing the 3 men the following day, keeping the boy captive.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 12 September. An alleged FRPI militiamen shot and killed a student in the village called ""Supreme"", located 93 kilometers south of Bunia in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in Irumu territory.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
column17: 12 September. DR Congo's navy on Wednesday accused Ugandan troops of killing four Congolese fishermen after their bodies surfaced on Lake Edward.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 12 September. A police officer was killed Wednesday (September 12th) in Maboya in Beni territory in an attack attributed to the Mai-Mai.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 12 Sept 2018, the FDLR-FOCA ambushed an FARDC convoy at Virunga Park near Bugomba village in Rutshuru territory. Four FARDC soldiers and two civilians were killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 September 2018, a bomb fell next to the TMB Bank in Bungulu commune in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Some reports suggest that it was an ADF attack, but this could not be corroborated. No fatalities or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 13 September. Five unidentified gunmen raided a house in the Mangodomu neighborhood of Mangina rural district. The attackers shot and killed a 32-year-old man.

column6: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
column17: 14 September. NDC-R captured Pitakongo (Bitakongo) from Mai-Mai

column6: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: 14 September. FNL attacked a Burundian border post. Two FNL forces and one Burundian soldier killed. Percise place at border not known.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2018, unknown armed bandits raided a house in Mangina (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killing the resident.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 14 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a woman and her teenage son in Kibirizi locality of Rutshuru territory.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 14 Sept 2018, the Mai-Mai Mazembe ambushed an FARDC convoy near Kabuhendo village in Rutshuru territory. One FARDC soldier as well as two civilians were killed and four other civilians were wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base in Kididiwe (coordinates approximate), in the Mayangose region. Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base at Point 46/Malolu in the Mayangose region (no coordinates available, in the Beni territory north of Beni city). Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

column6: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 15 September. Eleven people, including one soldier, were killed in attacks by a Lendu ethnic militia on FARDC naval forces' positions in Muvaramu, Songamoya and Tara in Djugu territory (Ituri) between 15-16 September (later reports indicated 15 fatalities). Approximately 30 people were abducted during the attacks. Eleven fatalities spread across the three locations. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 15 September. Between 2 and 4 am, police apprehended seven males, including teenagers, from the Kauka neighborhood of Kalamu. Five of the detainees were found dead the following day, at least one of the victim's genitals were cut off. The two others were forcibly disappeared. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

column6: Tshiyoyo Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 15 September. At least 10 people were seriously injured in a clash between security forces and alleged Tshiyoyo militiamen in Tshipidinga locality, in the vicinity of Kananga airport.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 15 September. The FARDC went to support the Burundian army at Gatumba border post during a RED TABARA attack. During the attackers' retreat, they killed three FARDC soldiers and two children on Congolese soil in the rural commune of Uvira.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 16 September. An unidentified armed group attacked Kididiwe, Beni (coordinates are approximate). No further details available.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 16 September, near Mbiangu, 15 men armed with AK-47s suspected to be LRA, looted civilians along the Kapili-Kana road. The assailants, who spoke Arabic and broken Lingala, abducted 1 boy.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
column17: 16 September. The Director of Rutshuru Prison and his wife were killed in their home by unidentified gunmen in Kiwanja City, about 70 km north of Goma.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 16 September 2018. At approximately 4 am, police forces took a man from his house in Kinshasa. The next morning the man's body, along with two other bodies were discovered. Two of the victims belonged to the Kuluna. All of the victims appeared to be strangled.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 September, in Mayawa, a group of 10 armed men entered the village and looted 3 homes of their potatoes, poultry, groundnuts, and other food. They reportedly wore military and civilian clothes and spoke broken Lingala and an unrecognized language. They departed west.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: 17 September. Two armed LRA combatants abducted a young girl 30 km south of Bangadi.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: 17 September. Two LRA combatants ambushed and looted two men 30km south of Bangadi.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 17 September. Renewed clashes between the FARDC and Mayi-Mayi coalition groups in Kilembwe, in the territory of Fizi.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 17 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kizamoto coalition leader was shot dead in clashes with the FARDC in the Bamuguba grouping in Shabunda territory (South Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 17 September. Unidentified gunmen raided Rubaya village in Masisi territory. The attackers killed a policeman, a man and a woman. They also injured four people.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 17 Sept 2018, the FDLR-RUD raided a house in Buganza village in Rutshuru territory at night. The attackers shot and killed a 42-year-old man.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 18 September. Five unknown gunmen were killed in clashes with the FARDC in Jiro, a town 62 kilometers north of Bunia in the Walendu Tatsi Sector of Djugu Territory (approx. Coordinates used).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 18 September. Mayi Mayi killed 15 FARDC soldiers in a battle at Mutombo (15 km north of Minembwe)

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 18 September. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group along the Mbau-Kamango road, Oicha. Two soldiers were killed.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column9: Beni Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 18 September 2018, Mayi Mayi militiamen entered the home of a policeman in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killed the police officer and kidnapped the chief of the neighbourhood.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2018, a mob captured two gangsters at Kitolu village in Kyondo commune of Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu), and beat them to death. [size=no report]

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 19 September 2019. Road construction workers demonstrated in front of Beni town hall, demanding their overdue wages. [size=approximately 100]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 19 September. The commander of the Mayi-Mayi Yakutumba group, Dokis, was killed during heavy clashes with the military in Kipupu, South Kivu.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 19 September. Five people were wounded, three seriously when police repressed a demonstration organised by the Civil Society Action Group (CCAC) in Kinshasa.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: On 19 September 2018, presumed ADF rebels made an incursion into Kokola village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and killed one woman, seriously injured two boys, kidnapped four kids, and stole six goats. Afterwards, the FARDC arrived to secure the area.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change
column17: 20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

column6: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
column17: On 20 September, in Gongolo, a group of 6 presumed LRA entered the village and looted houses and a medical dispensary. They abducted a young boy before departing. Two days later, the same group was sighted 7 km north of Ngilima with 1 girl and 4 boys held captive.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 20 September 2018, a FARDC vehicle arriving from Mayangose was ambushed by presumed ADF rebels in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). A soldier was killed and three others were injured.

column6: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
column17: On 20 Sept 2018, the CNRD raided Katsiru locality in Rutshuru territory, shooting a young man dead.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
column17: 20 September. The Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda attacked and chased after the Mai-Mai Kirikicho and Shalio at Busurungi village in Walikale territory.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change
column17: 20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 September 2018, four armed men ambushed a group of poaching fishermen at Kavuavua near Semuliki river in Beni territory (Beni, Nord-Kivu). One fisherman was injured and admitted to the hospital for treatment. The bandits ruined all the fishing gear.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 21 September. Unidentified men abducted a one-year-old child from the Mapendo neighborhood in Goma town. The kidnappers killed the child.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 21 Sept 2018, the FARDC arrested and killed two young men in Katoro village of Rutshuru territory.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 21 Sept 2018, alleged Mayi Mayi militants attacked an FARDC position at Rughenda district in Butembo town. Two people were killed and five were wounded.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: 22 September. After attacking an army position in Mabapula, east of Oicha, 35 km north of the city of Beni, ADF abducted 17 people, including children. Approx. Coordinates used.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 22 September. An army position in Mabapula, east of Oicha, 35 km north of the city of Beni, was burned by alleged ADF fighters, a civilian was killed and 17 went missing including children. Approx. coordinates used.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 22 September. The ADF attacked the FARDC in Kasinga. The attack was believed to be used as a distraction prior to launching an attack on Beni town later that day.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 22 September. Deputy Interior Minister Basile Olongo's convoy was attacked by unidentified gunmen at Hianga in Sankuru province. Olongo was on his way from Lodja to Katako Kombe. The convoy was guarded by policemen. There were several injured.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 September 2018, presumed ADF rebels clashed with FARDC in an attack on multiple neighbourhoods in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). ADF killed 14 civilians and 4 FARDC soldiers. They also destroyed and looted two shops, damaged three motorbikes and two cars, and burned four houses.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 23-24 September. Six people, including two soldiers and four civilians, were killed in two attacks by armed men against FARDC positions in Tagba (Sept 23rd) in Irumu, Ituri , and in Bule in Djugu territory (Sept 24th). Six fatalities spread over two events.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 23-24 September. Six people, including two soldiers and four civilians, were killed in two attacks by armed men against FARDC positions in Tagba (Sept 23rd) in Irumu, Ituri , and in Bule in Djugu territory (Sept 24th). Six fatalities spread over two events.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Makembi, Oicha. One soldier was killed.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 24 September: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a 30-year-old man from Pabuka village in Beni territory. The kidnappers killed the hostage.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. A police officer shot dead a man at a bistro in Kakuku village in Mwenga territory after a discussion about the exoneration of the Mwenga territorial administrator, who had been accused of supporting local gangs.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. Police dispersed protesters at Busawa village in Mwenga territory. The population was protesting the release of the territory's administrator.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 24 September. Police dispersed protesters at Busawa village in Mwenga territory. The population was protesting the release of the territory's administrator who had been arrested for supporting armed gangs and illegal possession of weapons.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 24 September 2018, the youths detained a soldier and managed to steal his weapon in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to give to the FARDC commander. The soldier was caught trying to steal a goat and shot the owner of the goat (coded separately). [size=no report]

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column9: Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 24 September 2018 (between 24 - 25 September), presumed ADF rebels made an incursion in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu), killed a pastor, abducted 15 children, burnt down 2 houses and looted many goods and animals. The hospital was also ransacked, forcing medical staff to abandon patients in the middle of operations.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); LUCHA: Fight for Change
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 September 2018, students and LUCHA activists demonstrated in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) over the deaths of two in their number. The PNC shot tear gas cannisters to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 September 2018, a man was slaughtered by unknown armed bandits in Mabuku groupment in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 September, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], a group of unidentified men with AK-47s reportedly looted houses late in the evening. They abducted a young woman and used her as a porter for looted goods. She remains unaccounted for and presumed still in captivity.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 September, near Bangadi, an unidentified armed group ambushed civilians on the road from Bangadi to Niangara, ordering some to purchase supplies in Bangadi. Local security forces arrested 1 of the victims under the suspicion that he was working with the armed group.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 25 September 2018, young people caught a FARDC soldier fleeing with a goat in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They grabbed his weapon and beat him to death. [size=no report]

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 25 September 2018, young people who had been in a meeting to discuss the security problem in their commune went and burned down the Boikene and Kasabinyole district offices in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 26 September. Unidentified gunmen raided a house and abducted a 51-year-old man from Kitemesho village in Uvira territory and killed him.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 26 September 2018, students and activists hung photos of victims of the 24 September massacre that occurred on 30th June Avenue in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), and were dispersed by police using tear gas. 3 people were hit by bullets. [size=at least 3]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 26 September 2018 (between 26 - 27 September), a man was shot to death in his shop by unknown armed men in Muvingi district in Kasindi (Beni, Nord-Kivu) after a long argument with the attackers.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 27 September 2018, alleged ADF rebels took back the FARDC position after a fierce fight in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities or injuries reported.

column17: On 27 September 2018, the FARDC dispersed a sit-in in front of the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) over rising insecurity. One soldier beat a man on orders from his commander. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 28 September 2018, a Mayi Mayi militia clashed with FARDC during an attempted attack on a prison in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 29 September 2018, four people were kidnapped at Mabuku (Beni, Nord-Kivu) by unknown armed men.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 29 September. Protest against the insecurity in the city of Bukavu. Police beat and abused a journalist on the margins of the protest who was covering the event.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 29 September. The ADF attacked the FARDC base in Mukoko (coordinates are approximate), a day after kidnapping civilians in the area.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 29 September. Police beat and abused a journalist on the margins of a protest against insecurity in Bukavu. The journalist was covering the event.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 29 September. Police beat seven activists (including Rebecca Kavugho and Queen Mwanzi) in Goma as they peacefully protested the continued violence in Beni.

column6: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 29 September. FDLR attacked FRDC positions in Mutao village in Nyiragongo territory and in nearby Kanyatsi village in Masisi territroy, forcing the inhabitants to flee. The FDLR came from the Virunga National Park. Coded as two separate events.

column17: On 29 Sept 2018, FARDC soldiers shot and killed a man near Lumbishi village in Kalehe territory.

column6: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
