column17: 01 October. A Lendu militia attacked the FARDC in Linga.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 01 October. A German tourist was killed by a man belonging to a gang of four assailants in the city of Boma. His wife survived.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change
column17: 01 October. Activists of the Fight for Change movement (LUCHA) marched in Kananga to condemn the continuing violence in Beni and to call on the authorities to secure people and their property.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 1 October 2018 (between 1 - 2 October), a person was targeted by unknown armed men and struck with a machete on their head in Masosi district in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They were brought to a hospital, and in the meantime their valuables were stolen.

column6: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
column17: On 1 Oct 2018, the NDC Guidon shot dead a man at Binyampuri village in Walikale territory.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 02 October. A group of armed men attacked a FARDC position in Karuruma, four attackers were killed in the army's response.

column6: Militia (Miners)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 02 October 2018. An armed group of miners clashed with police near the Kawama mine, in Haut-Katanga. The clash spilled over towards Kawama town, where a police officer shot and killed a teenager.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 02 October 2018. After a police officer shot and killed a teenager during a clash with miners, locals in Kawama, Haut-Katanga attacked the local police station and the home of a soldier.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 02 October. Report that Congolese forces were extorting money from DRC returnees at the border post of Kamako, 150 km south of Tshikapa, in the province of Kasai (approx. Coordinates used based on a humanitarian map). They were being forcibly returned from Angola.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change
column17: 02 October. LUCHA activists protested in Beni over insecurity in the territory for four years. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 2 October 2018, a man was killed by armed men dressed in FARDC military uniforms in the Masiki-Vahyana group of Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They also took some money and goods before vanishing.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03 October. Protesters in Oicha took to the streets to demand the release of 17 abductees including children in majority by ADF rebels on September 22 in Mabapula.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 01-07 October. FRPI members looted 16 villages in the Geti and Aveba areas.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 04 October. FARDC forces clashed with the FNL in Nyakabere.

column6: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 04 October. A Lendu militia attacked FARDC forces in Linga.

column6: CNPSC: National Coalition of the People for Congo's Sovereignty
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia
column17: On 4 Oct 2018, Mai-Mai CNPSC militants raided Ngoma mine in Fizi territory. The attackers killed two men and wounded another. They also looted money and property.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 October 2018, presumed ADF fighters clashed with FARDC during an attack on the Paida district of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Four soldiers and two civilians were killed and five injured, including one major. A second attack occurred in Beni in the evening, with the ADF targeting an FARDC position. A major was killed and there was a large displacement of the population during the second clash.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 5 October 2018 (between 5 - 6 October), armed men with knives and machetes entered a home in Mambale in Bashu chiefdom (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and stabbed the resident in the chest and arm with knives and then raped his daughter. They burned several materials and stole valuable items.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 05 October. The FARDC clashed with the FNL in Kiliba, Uvira.

column6: Militia (Kalenge Kabwa)
column17: 05 October 2018. Kalenge Kabwa combatants abducted two Mayi Mayi combatants in the Muntemune fishing camp (no coordinates available), 32 km from Pweto, Haut Katanga.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: 01-07 October. FRPI members looted 16 villages in the Geti and Aveba areas.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: Around 5 October 2018 (between 5 - 6 October), presumed ADF rebels made an incursion in the commune of Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu), took materials and attempted to burn a woman's house down.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 05 - 06 October. An unidentified armed group carried out an attack between PK 5, PK 6, and PK 7 along the Mbau Kamango road in Oicha. No further details available.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 06 October. 13 people (some sources report 14) were killed in an incursion by an armed group in the Rubaya mining trading center in Masisi territory. There is a history of tensions over mining rights in the area, as well as ethnic tensions between Hutu and Tutsi.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Looting: Between 28 May-24 June, suspected Batwa militiamen armed with arrows ambushed vehicles on 3 occasions along the Kalemie-Kabwela axis. The ambushes were meant to steal goods. Two NGO vehicles were targeted while on one occasion, one person was abducted for a few hours. Coded as three separate events.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 07 October. Demonstrators vandalized the office of the central police station of the PNC and released all the detainees Kolwezi. Six wounded policemen and several rioters arrested.

column6: Militia (Kalenge Kabwa)
column17: 07 October 2018. Kalenge Kabwa and his militia members entered Kaputuka, Haut-Katanga (coordinates are approximate based on location 2 km south of Pweto). The militia leader gathered members living in the village and departed.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 7 October 2018, a man suspected of being an ADF rebel was captured and beaten by a local mob in Butsili Quarter in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). An alert to the police permitted the man to escape. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 08 October 2018 (on or around). The FARDC responded went to Katanga, Dimbelenge after the Kabeya Lumbu militia attack the town. The militia had already vacated the town. The FARDC assaulted civilians and damaged properties, demanding to know where the militia was.

column6: Kabeya Lumbu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 08 October 2018. Following the withdrawal of the FARDC from Katanga, Dimbelenge on 03/10, the Kabeya Lumbu militia looted the village.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 08 October. Detonations of heavy and light weapons were heard in the commune of Ruwenzori around Kasinga city of Beni. Residents also left the place and moved to the city.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 08 October. Women gathered in the street of Beni to demand the return of peace in the municipality of Ruwenzori.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column7: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On 8 October 2018, MONUSCO reinforcements repelled an attack on Congolese military by suspected ADF fighters in Kasinga (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column9: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: 09 October. the ADF attacked an FARDC position, with MONUSCO support, at Mayi-Moya village of Oicha territory. The attackers also launched a rocket at a car carrying seven people. Eight people were killed, two people wounded (including 1 peacekeeper) and eight were reported missing.

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 October. Suspected ADF ambushed and killed two civilians in Kisiki-Maimoya on the Oisha-Eringeti National Highway No. 4 in Beni. FARDC intervened soon after, exchanging fire with the attackers (coded in a separate event).

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column17: 09 October. Suspected ADF ambushed and killed two civilians in Kisiki-Maimoya on the Oisha-Eringeti National Highway No. 4 in Beni. FARDC intervened soon after, exchanging fire with the attackers (coded in a separate event).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 9 October 2018, four civilians were stopped by FARDC and extorted in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They took money, silver household appliances and clothes and other household items.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 October 2018, schoolchildren and students demonstrated in the streets of Rwenzori district in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), over insecurity resulting in the closure of the majority of schools in the district. They threw projectiles in the schools to chase other students in full studies, wounding the supervisor of the Beni institute. They also barricaded Nyamwisi Boulevard with stones and police intervened with tear gas bombs. Police injured four. [size=no report]

column6: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
column9: Catholic Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 October 2018, civilians traveling in two cars owned by the Catholic church were ambushed by presumed ADF fighters in Kisiki village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). 7 were killed, including the driver, 3 were wounded, and 8 abducted.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 10 October 2018, armed men abducted and looted from a man in Kalunguta village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 10 October. FARDC forces clashed with the Kamwina Nsapu militia during operations in the Kamonia region. 10 militia members were killed during the clashes which lasted two days (coded as five per day).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 10 Oct 2018, unidentified gunmen dressed in military uniforms shot and killed a teenage boy in Lulimba locality of Fizi territory. The also stole two phones from the victim.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 10 October 2018, locals suspected the presence of Rwandan migrants in Kitsanfa quarter in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), and attempted to attack them. The police intervened to disperse them with tear gas. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 October 2018, students demonstrated at the town hall in Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu), demanding peace in the city. The police dispersed them by shooting live bullets. A 21 year-old boy was shot dead and 3 others were seriously injured. The same day, a teachers' union declared an unlimited strike until security returns to the region. [size=no report]

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 10-11 October. The people of Tshonka in Shabunda territory (South Kivu) organized protests over two days to demand the departure of a mining operator.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: EC: Together For Change
column17: 10 October. During the trial of Moise Katumbi Chapwe, activists of ""Together for Change"" stormed the Court, to show their support for their leader.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 11 October. FRPI forces clashed with the FARDC near Geti.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 11 October. Clashes between the FARDC and Nsapu militia continued in the Kamonia region. 10 militia members were killed during the two days of clashes (coded as five per day).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 11 October. A police officer shot and wounded a FARDC soldier and four men resisting arrest om Kalehe.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: 11 October. Hundreds of teachers from all the unions of the schools of the city of Bukavu (South Kivu) protested in front of the cabinet of the governor of province, to denounce the insecurity in the schools of the city.

column6: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 10-11 October. The people of Tshonka in Shabunda territory (South Kivu) organized protests over two days to demand the departure of a mining operator.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 12 Oct 2018, FARDC soldiers shot and killed a man in his house in Lulimba locality of Fizi territory. The attackers also stole the victim's property.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column6: Government of Angola (1975-)
column17: October 1-11: A total of 188,720 suspected illegal Congolese migrants in Angola were forcibly returned to Kasai.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) National Intelligence Agency
column17: On 13 Oct 2018, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a man at Rwabangi village in Rutshuru territory. The attackers suspected the victim of being an ANR collaborator.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki)
column17: On Oct 13, a 58-year old man was kidnapped by members of Raia Mutomboki Ndusha in Karembu village in Walungu territory. He was accused of not having payed a debt. They demanded a ransom of $600 for his release.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: In the night between Oct 13 and 14 a Congolese journalist was kidnapped by unknown armed men in Uvira.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 13 October 2018 (as reported), the body of a man with traces of torture were found in the brush of Mamove village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 14 October 2018. One child was killed and three others were injured by an explosive device in Kasumaka, Ituri (coordinates are approximate based on location 4 km east of Geti). According to local residents, the children were killed by an RPG fired by the FARDC. The military denies this and reported they died while unknowingly handling a mine.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 14 Oct 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and killed a man who had resisted that his goats were stolen during looting in Ngugo village in Rutshuru territory. The soldier was arrested.

column17: On 14 October 2018, 17 cows were taken by the Nduma Mayi Mayi militia from someone's farm in Kabasha village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and headed for Buliki.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around 14 October 2018 (between 14 - 15 October), a taxi driver was shot by a group of four FARDC soldiers who were extorting him in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu). He was brought to the hospital and they took telephones and other items of value.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: 14 October. An alleged highwayman died lynched by young people during the night time hours in Kakombe district.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: During the month of October, Batwa militias raped and gang raped 17 women along the Kalemie-Kabulo-Kioko road in Tanganyika. The attacks often occurred as the group attacked villages. Coded as four incidents each week in October.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: In October, the FARDC clashed with a Batwa militia in Tanganyika.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 15 October. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Boaba, Beni (no coordinates available). Two soldiers were killed, one was injured and three were abducted.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On Oct 15, militiamen from the Mai-Mai Kilalo faction attacked a FARDC position at Samboko village in Beni territory. They killed three and wounded four FARDC soldiers.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

column17: On Oct 15, an unidentified gunman shot dead a member of the national intelligence agency in Rushovu village in Rutshuru territory.

column6: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
column17: On 15 Oct 2018, the NDC Guidon tortured a man at Robe village in Walikale territory, accusing him of non-payment of token fees. The victim died from his injuries.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: Around 15 October 2018 (between 15 - 16 October), FARDC soldiers abducted and threatened to kill a man in Kabasha village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They tried to leverage the abduction to extort money and goods from the general public.

column7: AJR: Association of Responsible Youth
column17: 15-17 October. The Association of Responsible Youth (AJR) protested against toll collection barriers set up by agents of the provincial executive on the roads of North Ubangi. On the third day, police dispersed the protest.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column7: AJR: Association of Responsible Youth
column17: 15-17 October. The Association of Responsible Youth (AJR) protested against toll collection barriers set up by agents of the provincial executive on the roads of North Ubangi. On the third day, police dispersed the protest.

column17: 17 October. The Kamwina Nsapu militia attacked the FARDC in Katenga (coordinates are approximate; based on location 50 km north-east of Kananga).

column7: AJR: Association of Responsible Youth
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 October 2018, a man was kidnapped by unknown armed men, but was released after a ransom of 2,500 dollars was paid in Mangina commune (Beni, Nord-Kivu). When he was released he had head wounds.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 18 Oct 2018, the police killed a teenager at Chitungano village in Kabare territory.

column17: On 18 October 2018, soldiers invaded a man's home in Oicha city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and after intimidating him stole 3 flash disks, a flatscreen, telephone, and money.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On Oct 22, protests broke out in Nyiragongo because of a land dispute and escalated into clashes with the police that left 4 dead. Locals of that territory refuse to leave their houses as ordered by the local authorities.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 22 Oct 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and killed a civilian at Pk 5 in Beni territory. The victim was returning from his field.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On Oct 22, police clashed with demonstrators in Munig who were protesting against the eviction of some citizens from a concession at Munigi village in Nyiragongo territory. In the clashes two people died and other two were injured.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On Oct 22 the spokesman for the presidential majority was targeted and unknown people fired some shots from a car to his house. Nobody was injured.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On 22 October 2018, Mayi Mayi militiamen attacked a FARDC position in the Paida neighbourhood of Beni city (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Two militiamen were killed and another one captured. Some sources indicate that two civilians were also killed during the attack.

column6: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: On Oct 23, riots continued for the second day over a land dispute in Nyiragongo. Demonstrators set barricades along the secondary road in order to prevent police action.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: 23 October. FARDC forces clashed with Red-TABARA in Rubarika (no coordinates available), Uvira. Four rebels were killed and six were arrested. The military also seized weapons from the group.

column6: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
column17: 09 October - 05 November. A Lendu militia attacked the FARDC in Bule.
